details:
Data Scientist
Position Summary:
 
Seeking a talented, experienced and inquisitive Data Scientist to design and implement cutting edge solutions across a breadth of domain areas.  The ideal candidate is well grounded in a mathematical, statistical and probability background, with a broad knowledge of machine learning techniques and cognitive services.
 
This Data Scientist will focus on selecting, evaluating, and optimizing software solutions, code development, and integrations into IT systems as part of a growing Data Science. This individual will work with a multidisciplinary team of driven people to deliver end to end solutions that improve guest experience and address pain points of the business across applications such as Cloud Computing, Data Science Virtual Machines (Linux), Optimal Scripting Techniques, and Distributed File / Computational Systems.
 

Data Scientist-Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
 
A successful candidate will possess a strong background or operational familiarity in statistics, mathematics, modeling (predictive, forecasting, optimization).  The candidate should demonstrate a progressive maturation of prior technical and development projects from ad-hoc requests to fully fault-tolerant and optimized solutions architected into broader IT systems.  The candidate should also be capable of and willing to train and mentor colleagues on the proper training, development and deployment of technically robust and optimizing analytic solutions for data science applications.
 
This individual will be responsible for analytical support, data mining, scripting / programming, mentorship and stakeholder presentation within the framework of implementing, utilizing and expanding development and release best practices within the broader Data Science team. 
 
Data Scientist Major responsibilities include:
 
·         Apply several forms of statistical (hypothesis testing, sampling, modeling, probability, time-series) and machine learning (neural networks / deep networks, ensemble methods, natural language processing) methods to describe, predict and optimize desired analytical objectives from business stakeholders.
 
·         Manipulates high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources to highlight patterns, anomalies, relationships and trends.
·         Evaluate the progress of the data science team and company at large on the acclimation of robust, optimal and faul-tolerant technical solutions for predictive, natural language and artificial intelligence tasks. Recommend steps to improve or enforce utilization of these methods.
·         Empower and enhance the capabilities of the broader data science team on the proper environment setup, optimal and faul-tolarant scripting of solutions, and efficiency of deployed models through training, mentoring and project assistance as needed. 
·         Collaborate with IT, Business and Analytics stakeholders to design and implement solution infrastructure, release schedules, and system needs into the wider company data architecture.
·         Assist with research related to customer based analytical practice and develop communications for management and strategies for building institutional knowledge. Work with product and enterprise teams via both Agile And Waterfall Methodologies.
 
·         Foster a ‘data-driven’ culture based on pragmatism and strategic decision through rigorous factual analysis at all levels.  Should be willing to engage outside the immediate team to expand data science footprint throughout organization.
 




 

Data Scientist Qualifications
·         Master’s degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Chemical Engineering, Information Technology or field of comparable foundations in mathematical and statistical analysis through the use of models, algorithms or programmed solutions.
·         2+ years experience with any of the following programming languages: R, Python, Java, C++, C#, Scala, SAS or similar scripting languages.  Similar experience and proficiency with SQL required.
·         2+ years experience with a variety of information technology tools and practices including Software Engineering and Development (documentation, programming), Operations (event monitoring, software deployments, system administration), and Quality Assurance (positive / negative unit testing, maintenance)
·         Experience with data mining processes (SEMMA, CRISP-DM), data preparation, consolidation, imputation, transformation, interaction, variable reduction, modeling, maintenance, and post-mortem analysis.
·         Experience with statistical methods such t-test of means, Tukey-HSD tests of means on groups, ANOVA, Proportion tests, data normalization and scaling, univariate and multivariate outlier detection.
·         Experience with modeling techniques such as linear models, decision trees, neural networks, k-nearest-neighbor, support vector machines, cluster analyses, and ensembling methods.
·         Strong Oral and Written skills.

 
Data Scientist Preferred Qualifications in Addition to Basic Qualifications



         Experience with Agile Software Development


         Terminal or Shell scripting in Linux systems


         Experience in a large corporation or consulting firm with focus in marketing strategies, modeling, CRM and management sciences/statistics highly desired


         Experience with Deep Learning tools and packages such as TensorFlow, Keras, H2O, and Theano


        Experience with frameworks and languages designed for big-data analysis, including Hadoop, Spark, Hive, and Pig


        Experience with cloud computing frameworks or API’s such as Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services and IBM / Watson



 






Irvens André
Sr. Technical Recruiter
Synergy Business Consulting, Inc.

details:
Machine Vision Research Scientist (DOD Security Clearance)— Torrance, CAA fast-growing Southern California company specializing in military defense, homeland security, and energy solutions is seeking a hand-on Research Scientist for its Electro-Optics Division. The successful candidate should be eager to work in a very dynamic, fast-paced research and development setting with a number of Ph.D.-level engineers and scientists.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
 Development, integration, and test of machine vision systems and subsystems.
 Deriving system requirements and specifications with a technical team.
 Developing and realizing software designs as a team member or a technical lead.
 Apply methods of image acquisition/processing/analysis systems and interpreting results of tradeoffs analyses (e.g., resolution, field-of-view, size, weight, power, cost, manufacturability
 Develop new scientific and engineering concepts, carry out design and development, write winning proposals, execute technical tasks of the contract, realize prototypes, perform test and evaluation, provide documentation, manage multidisciplinary projects.
 Participates in and supports development and implementation of new or updated systems, processes, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and/or other relevant tools.

Job Requirements:
 MS required with 5-8 years’ experience, PhD preferred with 3-5 years’ experience (Computer Science, Robotics, Image Processing, and other related engineering areas preferred).
 Experienced in theory and practical implementations of the machine vision, robotic vision, image/video based machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
 Experience in the modern computer science tools (programing languages e.g. Matlab, C/C++, OpenGL and OpenCV libraries, etc.) for 3D reconstruction, object detection, tracking, classification and recognition.
 Demonstrated skills in image processing, computational geometry, computer graphics, mathematical modelling of physical and engineering objects/processes, algorithm development.
 Experienced in methods of image acquisition/processing/analysis systems easy applying results of the tradeoffs analysis (e.g., resolution, field-of-view, size, weight, power, cost, manufacturability) and component selections.
 Ability to multitask and work as individual contributor and be an excellent team player.
 Good verbal and written communication skills are required.
 MUST be eligible for DOD Security Clearance—requires U.S. Citizenship, U.S. Permanent Residency, or other status as defined by 8 USC 1324b(a)(3)

details:
SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
 
PROJECT DETAILS
LOCATION: Boston, MA
START DATE: ASAP
LOA: 6 month contract-to-full time
 
PROJECT DESCRIPTION
TPA Technologies is seeking a Senior Data Scientist.  Our SaaS Software client has an immediate need for a talented Senior Data Scientist to design, implement, and maintain frameworks for ranking, classification, and recommendation. He or she would research bleeding edge techniques and tools in ML/Deep Learning/AI.  This individual will be the lead Data Scientist for the organization.

This is a client facing role, and the ideal candidate will have experience leading off-shore development teams (Eastern Europe and India).

Applicants must be eligible to convert to full time, and our client is not able to provide sponsorship.

ABOUT TPA TECHNOLOGIES
TPA technologies, formerly known as The Professional Alternative, is a solutions partner serving the Information Technology needs of Corporate America and Government Business partners. We utilize methodologies developed over 10 years to provide "Best Fit" solutions. A proven leader in identifying technical professionals best suited to have an immediate and positive impact on the needs of our clients' requirements. Business partners are provided with the ability to obtain desired results and the flexibility required to ensure cost effective solutions.

REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS
§  1+ year of experience developing machine learning models such as using deep learning methods for classification and regression
§  Experience with Python, R, Scala, Java, C/C++ or other related languages
§  Comfort with SQL and NoSQL DB, MapReduce, Apache Spark, Kafka and other large scale data processing tools for performing various tasks related to machine learning and data science activities including data cleanup, data transformation, data mashing and algorithm parallelization
§  Experience with: Caffe, Torch, TensorFlow, Theano, Matlab or a similar deep learning toolkit
§  A strong “GSD” or “Agile” mindset – focus on shipping products, not perfection
§  Required education: Advanced Degree(PhD) in Computer Science, Data Science or Mathematics Experience with one or more of the following: Classification, Computer Vision, Statistical Modeling, Ranking and Relevancy Systems, Recommendation Systems, etc.
§  Machine Learning: 1 year,
§  Python: 2 years
§  AWS: 1 year
§  Linux: Various flavors

You will then leverage machine learning and related methods to solve those problems. Working with the business you will implement the solutions.    Qualifications: We are seeking leaders who have completed or will soon complete a PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a closely related field.  You will also have:    Demonstrated abilities to manage multiple priorities well  Strong written and verbal communications skills  Extensive experience with wide range of advanced machine learning methods  In depth understanding of Deep Learning and experience with imaging applications  Very good understanding of explainable AI  Proficient with Python including Pandas, NumPy and Scikit-learn    All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor.  Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed.  Job Type: Standard More information about the job Is Relocation Available? Yes, nationwide Is there a bonus structure? Yes Does this position have direct reports? No Who does this position report to? Fluency with current data science methods and related tools e.g. SQL, Python or R, Jupyter Notebooks and GitHub  Experience with deep learning methods and tools including RNNs, CNNs, TensorFlow  Experience with data visualization best practices and tools such as Tableau  Strong interpersonal communication skills     What are the nice-to-have skills?    Image handling and querying expertise with imaging pipeline related skills e.g. experience with OpenCV, FFMPEG; experience with Docker and micro-services  Database proficiency (relational, NoSQL, MongoDB)  Experience with Big Data technologies including Cloud Technologies (Amazon AWS, Azure, Google) and Database technology (Hadoop, MS SQL Server)  Familiarity with statistical methods and tools such as R, JMP     What is exciting about this opportunity? Thriving in a culture of innovation, you will collaborate closely with other experts leveraging cutting edge tools to develop irresistibly superior products.

details:
The Senior NLP Scientist / Engineer is a key technical contributor in the design and development of state-of-the-art NLP for medical applications.  The Senior NLP Scientist\Engineer works closely with other NLP specialists, software engineers and subject matter experts on current company technologies, and serves in a technical lead capacity on forward looking projects.  

The successful candidate will have a strong background in Natural Language Processing, Artificial Intelligence with an emphasis on text, Information Extraction / Retrieval, and/or associated principles of knowledge representation and ontological design. The successful candidate will be a forward-thinker comfortable with research and design, but also demonstrate a willingness to support team members with existing systems in customer production environments. Technical aptitude is required, as the successful candidate will be a core contributor on teams responsible for taking ideas from vision through design to implementation.

While the Senior NLP Scientist / Engineer role spans responsibilities in both research and development, position emphasis may be tailored to the skill sets of the successful candidate.

Primary Responsibilities:

Identification, research and development of new technologies to enhance existing company NLP solutions and extend those solutions to new applications and markets 

Analysis and refactoring of existing system architectures, with focus on functionality and performance


Required Qualifications:

Advanced degree in Computational Linguistics, Computer Science, or other Computational discipline 

4+ years of related professional work experience for applicants holding an MS - OR - 2+ years related professional work experience for applicants holding a PhD (significant academic NLP experience will be considered for strong applicants) 

Knowledge of the algorithms and techniques of a computational domain with emphasis on text processing, performance and scalability 

Demonstrated technical aptitude 

Strength and experience with at least one of the following 
C++ 

Java 

C# 

Python



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with data science or machine learning 

Experience with Drools 

Experience with SQL 

Understanding of morphology, syntax, semantics, discourse and/or pragmatics 

Experience applying NLP in a medical domain 

Language skills in Portuguese or Spanish 

Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

title: Marketing Data Scientist

details:
Data Scientist
Up to $130K


Pinnacle Partners is assisting their client in their search for a Data Scientist.  The successful resource can be someone who has many years’ experience with Data Science or a person who has their Masters and 1-2 years’ experience. The resource will join the machine learning team which has formed into an official unit, Advanced Data Science, which is responsible for all machine learning and artificial intelligence throughout the organization. Projects are being worked within every business unit and industry vertical. The company offers strong benefits and PTO and the resource can join the team in Indianapolis or Chicago.
 

Responsibilities 



Capable of levering large sets of structured and unstructured data to develop tactical and strategic insights.


Collaborate with analytic and data teams to set objectives, approaches, and work plans.


Research and evaluate new analytical methodologies, approaches, and solutions.


Develop and validate statistical forecasting models and tools.


Interpret and communicate analytic results to analytical and non-analytical business partners and executive decision makers.



 

 


Required Skills 



Advanced degree (Masters at a minimum) in a quantitative field in one or more of the following: Statistics (preferred), Computer Science, or Data Science


4+ years’ experience in advanced analytics and machine learning model development and validation.


2+ years’ experience working in industry, leading analytic-based projects, and delivering results within scope, funding, and duration. 


2+ years’ experience leading projects and interacting with non-technical users to explain modeling results and meaning.


Modeling Experience:  Forecasting (ARIMA, ARCH, GARCH), Anomaly Detection, Dimension Reduction, Clustering Techniques, Hypothesis Testing


Should have excellent communication skills.


Expert level programming skills in R.


Experience with a statistical package and various programming languages such as R, Python, Java, C++, SAS, Matlab, etc.


Business Intelligence experience (Microsoft Power BI / Tableau)


Experience writing SQL queries and linking to enable read/write to the database.


The capacity for a high degree of autonomy and out-of-the-box thinking


Terms

This is a direct hire role with a salary up to $130K.

About the Team: Applied Technology professionals at Crowe lead the software development efforts for the firm and build technology solutions in a consistent and reliable way.  Applied Technology owns the software development competency for the firm, which is tied to standardized processes, practices, policies and controls for client-facing products and projects.  Team members share expertise across various industries, targeting manufacturing and distribution, government, healthcare, financial services, and private equity groups based on demand from other Business Units.  You will learn and build on a wide range of technologies in an environment where innovation and new ideas are highly encouraged.  Hop on board to join one of the fastest growing technology consulting practices in the industry!Our Benefits:At Crowe, we know that great people is what makes a great firm.  We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package.  Learn more about what working at Crowe can mean for you!How You Can Grow:We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity.  You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach that will guide you in your career goals and aspirations. Learn more about where talent can prosper!Visit Crowe Careers to find out how you can grow your career and make an impact every day!    More about Crowe Horwath:Crowe Horwath LLP (www.crowehorwath.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Horwath International, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world.Company OverviewYour Journey at Crowe Starts Here:At Crowe Horwath LLP, you have the opportunity to deliver innovative solutions to today’s complex business issues.   Crowe’s accounting, consulting, and technology personnel are widely recognized for their in-depth expertise and understanding of sophisticated process frameworks and enabling technologies, along with their commitment to delivering measurable results that help clients build business value.  Our focus on emerging technology solutions along with our commitment to internal career growth and exceptional client value has resulted in a firm that is routinely recognized as a “Best Place to Work.”  We are 75 years strong and still growing.  Come grow with us!

This position is located in Seattle, WA.  Relocation assistance is provided.

We’re all in at DoubleDown.  Are you?
In this high-visibility Data Scientist role, you will be part of our 10-person team of Data Scientists, Analysts and Engineers.  Reporting to the Manager, Data Science and Analytics, you will build and analyze data sets to derive business insights and communicate those results to users in marketing, production andengineering having the opportunity to make a BIG impact on business decisions.  Our data sets are large and deep and you will get the opportunity to work with the most advance cloud-based tools available.
 
Roll the dice
We're DoubleDown Interactive, a talented team of approximately 170 Software Engineers, Game Designers, Artists, Producers, Marketers, Analytical Experts, and more.  Located in Seattle’s International District, we create fun, authentic casino-style entertainment via free-to-play social and mobile games, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. As a leader in the social casino space, we continue to revolutionize through constant innovation. Known for our fun and collaborative culture, we move quickly to deliver exciting online game experiences to casino enthusiasts and social gamers alike!

Winning the jackpot
The Business Intelligence team is responsible for the design and maintenance of our rapidly growing multi-Terabyte sized data warehouse and the reporting and analysis of data contained within it.  During your first year, you’ll be making major contributions to the growth of the business by understanding andpresenting business insights to key decision makers at DoubleDown by identifying and quantifying key growth drivers.  Also, you will be able to demonstrate expertise in one or more key company performance areas such as monetization, new accounts, engagement, retention, etc.  .
 
Placing your best bet - the responsibilities

Partner with internal teams to define and prioritize reporting and analysis requirements
Leverage your data analysis and statistical modeling prowess to deliver actionable recommendations

Create custom reports using SQL and analyze and present the results to internal customers so the best business decisions are made



What you should bring to the table


2+ years data analytics experience 


Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, related discipline or equivalent experience


Intellectual curiosity and strong problem-solving skills 


Experience working with large data sets and loves to work with data


Keen ability to communicate, including experience communicating technical concepts to a non-technical audience


Experience using SQL and Excel for data analysis and presentation. 


Coursework in statistics, machine learning or data mining


Experience in statistical data analysis and data mining packages (R, Python, SPSS, Matlab)

Ability to think creatively and to work well both as part of a team and as an individual contributor

Master’s degree in Business, Statistics, related discipline or equivalent experience is a plus!



Cashing in on the comps



Getting to the office is a breeze with one of our two company-sponsored transportation options:

ORCA pass, renewed annually
$100 monthly transportation credit



Stow your ride safely in the secured parking garage or bike locker available onsite.


It’s a gaming company, so take a gaming break and get to know your coworkers with a little competitive fun! Square off over ping pong, foosball, or pinball in our arcade.  Like console games?  Challenge your coworkers to a Nintendo Wii U or Xbox 360 gaming break.  You’ll find plenty of takers for a tabletop gaming session, too!


Stay in tip-top shape by taking advantage of our onsite fitness center.  Just head down to the first floor of our building, and you’ll have access to state of the art equipment, lockers, and showers. 


Need to relax? Get a massage or enjoy a yoga session right here in the studio! After all, who wants to work without a massage?


Enjoy occasional afternoons off for private viewings of first-run movies and team outings to see the Mariners play.


Hungry? Head to one of our two kitchens fully stocked with snacks and beverages.


You’ll never want to take the day off on Wednesdays, when we even provide a gourmet breakfast.


Want to go out to lunch sometimes, too? Our International District location is perfectly situated near a variety of excellent restaurants.


As if all of this isn't cool enough, you'll love our benefit package.


We offer medical, dental, vision, prescription coverage, maternity/paternity leave, and disability protection (short- and long-term).


Every team member receives 15 days of vacation, 40 hours of sick time, 2 personal floating holidays, and 11 paid calendar holidays per year.


Combine all of this with our amazing work/life balance and company-matched retirement options, and you have the dream job!
title: Data Scientist

details:
Job Description - Machine Learning Specialist
MACHINE LEARNING SCIENTIST
Seeking an experienced Machine Learning Scientist to join an established and growing data-centric organization downtown.  The Machine Learning Scientist will be responsible for machine learning and statistical techniques to address business goals and assess future enhancements for the company's platform. Ideal candidates will have strong fundamentals in statistical methods, machine learning as well as experience in product-focused software development.  The Machine Learning Specialist will be integral in evaluating the possibilities for future product enhancements, developing proof-of-concepts, and creating documentation to guide the development of market-ready tools by other developers on the team.  
 
Responsibilities:
Contribute to the development of new products through analysis, sound engineering, and the application of machine learning.
Create such things as visualizations, metrics, algorithms, statistical tests, classifiers/regressors, and data structures.
Locate and vet new libraries, data stores, algorithms, and other new technologies to support the various data products.
Build tools to make your work, the work of the analytics team, and analysis efforts in the entire company easier, more repeatable, and higher quality.
Participate in research to keep our products competitive and intelligent through machine learning and artificial intelligence. 
Provide consultation to all areas of the business about what is impossible, maybe possible, or possible as it relates to machine learning.
Promulgate analysis techniques and technologies through the organization.
Manage workflow using JIRA, participate in discovery and sprint planning.
Collaborate with product management and engineering groups to commercialize data products.
 
Requirements:
Graduate degree in an analytical field (computer science, applied statistics, etc.)
Solid experience with or demonstrated knowledge of Machine Learning techniques.  
Natural Language Processing, is a plus.
Some intriguing stories about how you've employed clustering, regression, classification, anomaly detection to solve business problems.
Experience with tools for preprocessing, automated model selection and hyper-parameter optimization.  Experience with TensorFlow and Keras is a plus.
Strong programming skills, preferably using some combination of Python, R, Java, and Groovy.  Experience developing scalable algorithms using Spark, Beam or other big data tools.
SQL
Ability to match the appropriate analytical technique to sometimes ambiguous problems and large, messy & unstructured data sets.
High energy and drive, coupled with resourcefulness, required to succeed in a start-up environment
Passion for problem solving and knowledge sharing
Ability to shift priorities quickly and efficiently, and easily adapt to change
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

title: Data Engineer/Scientist

details:
Data Scientist, Chantilly, VA OR Annapolis Junction, MD 

Our client is seeking a Data Scientist for a Contract to Hire opportunity in Chantilly, VA OR Annapolis Junction, MD.
Note:  Any non-US citizen to work on the contract must be able to prove US residency for a period of three (3) years prior to the commencement of work on this contract.

Description

The Data Scientist performs a pivotal and critical position supporting the development and implementation of complex solutions for the Affordability Care Act (ACA) and its many provisions.
This position works closely with Senior Management and Customers to conceptualize and define solutions that meet and exceed customer expectations.
The project involves supporting the complex data analytics, business intelligence, and reporting necessary to provide decision support services for business areas operating under the purview of the ACA.
Our client's solution leverages leading edge technology to support and analyze modern health care policy, providing an incredible opportunity to apply and grow your skills.
This position is a combination of a technical Data analyst (60%) and the more traditional technical developer (40%) role. 
It is a hands-on role in terms of running queries against XML and Hive databases in support of analysis, QA, data profiling and report reconciliation.

Responsibilities 

Opening and mining data from a relational database in Hive and xml files for the purpose creating reports.
Analyze large IT systems and identify metrics to measure and improve business efficiency.
Writing HiveQL / SQL queries to populate databases or creating recon reports.
Review data diagrams to understand entity relationships and data values that define uniqueness.
Analyze data to confirm relationships and identify potential data quality issues.
Capability to lead discussions and meetings.
Work closely with Customers to assess complex business needs.  Identify and define client business requirements based on evolving policy directives. This includes proposing processes for business analysis and workflow, identifying key performance indicators, and developing the system requirements to support the business
Work closely with the delivery teams to ensure solutions are developed to meet/exceed our customer expectations
Define the scope of the effort, the key resources and critical activities to contribute to LOE discussions.
Apply a solid understanding of the business needs and available data to propose and document design requirements.  Documentation includes the Requirements Traceability Matrix, report layouts, reporting dimensions, and data mapping data from CVS file elements.





3+ years of hands on SQL / XML experience in Unix environment, preferably using Hadoop
5+ years in a Data analyst role on software implementation projects
Experience developing and documenting business requirements, Interface Control documents, and business intelligence reporting requirements for business intelligence, master data management and functional-data projects.


Please Note

Only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
No calls, inquiries, or Third Party Vendors please.
We are an equal opportunity employer (Unable to sponsor H1B Visas).

Since 1988, The ACI Group, a Baltimore-based IT staffing firm, has been committed to hiring the industry’s leading professionals, and presenting exciting career opportunities. We have access to varied types of contract, permanent and contract-to-perm positions and offer a choice of employment options including a full benefits package.

details:
~ Please note, this position is located in Raleigh, NC, however remote options may be available for exceptionally qualified candidates~

Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly growing in importance for LexisNexis. We're seeing the acceleration of amazing AI work being developed in the Legal market. LexisNexis customers expect the most comprehensive, current and accurate data in an era of unprecedented information volume; meeting these needs requires faster, more comprehensive document and legal enhancements delivery.

The challenge for our Global Editorial Operations teams is how we improve processes and mine the huge data set we have to unlock its value as our customer needs change. In line with the LexisNexis corporate strategy of greater content volume, types and sophistication, the services that Global Editorial Operations provides are becoming increasingly dependent on Smart Content. We are looking for an AI Expert who will drive and deliver an AI strategy to enable our content teams to process and enrich more content. You will be working globally with our business units to develop our content and information solutions. Many of these processes rely on human interaction to both create and curate content, and this will continue. We want to introduce more automation to these processes by capturing human inputs and supporting them with AI engines.

Ultimately, machine learning tools, for example, may suggest annotations and structured meta-data that are as good as human-generated data and even replace human annotations.

You will be working in LexisNexis Operations with a varied group and cross-functional team of content domain experts, IT and product colleagues to pilot and develop new methods of processing, extracting and surfacing information relevant to our customers.

When successful, the AI expert will support the implementation of industry-scale, high-quality production systems. Sample projects may include document summarization, classification, citation structuring / resolution, redaction, concept / keyword suggestion and normalization, and Deep Learning from annotated data. The role requires the presentation of findings to the business in ways that can be readily understood by all business counterparts.

Accountabilities:

Architect solutions leveraging AI services, working closely with our editorial, technology and product teams to deeply understand their business needs and to design a solution that takes best advantage of a centralized, best-in-class AI service
Prove viability of the solution through mechanisms like proof-of-concepts or prototypes
Thought Leadership Craft & develop compelling audience-specific messages and tools (demos, whitepapers, presentations, how to guides etc.) Evangelize AI services and technologies through forums such as blogs, Whitepapers and speaking events. Capture and share best practices and insights internally and with partners and customers.
Serve as a key member of development teams helping to ensure success on the AI platform. Act as a technical liaison between editorial, technology and product teams. Provide updates on progress and ensure plan execution by partners.
The candidate will possess both technical and customer-facing skills that will allow them to be a trusted advisor. He or she will be able to facilitate relationships with senior personnel, as well as easily interact and give guidance to content domain experts, technical experts, software developers, IT pros, and other architects. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.
Highly developed interpersonal, collaboration, mentorship, motivation, leadership, negotiation and decision-making skills; ability to interact effectively and build relationships with the highest levels of organizations, including executive leadership and stakeholders. Outstanding relationship building and communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to translate the language of technology for the business management team.
Keen strategic and analytical thinker with the ability to put complex ideas into clear frameworks, and use data to drive innovation.
Embodies the work ethic and personality that thrives in a fast-paced culture with tight deadlines, shifting priorities, and matrix managed responsibilities.
Seeks to identify root causes and recommends solutions to avoid repeat of problems. Shows a high level of skills in breaking down problems into their essential elements, carrying out a diagnosis and developing a solution.
Continuously seeks out improvement and innovation opportunities in analytic technologies that have immediate and meaningful impact on business.

LexisNexis Legal & Professional (www.lexisnexis.com) is a leading global provider of content and technology solutions that enable professionals in legal, corporate, tax, government, academic and non-profit organizations to make informed decisions and achieve better business outcomes. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis and Nexis services. Today, LexisNexis Legal & Professional harnesses leading-edge technology and world-class content, to help professionals work in faster, easier and more effective ways. Through close collaboration with its customers, the company ensures organizations can leverage its solutions to reduce risk, improve productivity, increase profitability and grow their business. Part of RELX Group plc,


Competitive salary plus comprehensive benefits package to include:
      • Medical/Dental/Vision       •  Quarterly 401K Match       •  Paid Time Off       •  Paid Holidays       •  Two Paid Volunteer Days       •  Employee Stock Purchase Plan       •  Employee Assistance Program        •  Health Spending, Flexible Spending & Commuter Spending Accounts

Experience deploying software solutions to a cloud framework (e.g. Azure, AWS, Google)

ESG Automotive is the go-to source for electrical engineering consulting in the automotive industry. Join ESG Automotive’s team and help create the technology of tomorrow.


Job Title: ADAS Algorithm Developer

Location: Troy, Michigan

What you’ll be doing:

An ADAS Algorithm Developer you will be part of an integrated global team, you will develop robust, real-time, vehicle control algorithms for autonomous driving using active safety radar and vision systems.

Responsibilities include:

Algorithm development including: Lane centering, Automatic Lane Change, Adaptive Cruise Control, Lane Keep Assist, Forward Collision Warning, Emergency Automatic Brake, Blind Spot Alert, Cross Traffic Alert, etc.
Data analysis to assess and correct performance deficiencies

Function demonstration to OEMs and customer requirement implementation
Optimization for real-time implementation
Performance assessment and reporting

details:
Job Description 
Principal Research ScientistHuman-Machine Teaming and Human-Centered AnalyticsIntelligent Adaptive SoftwareBAE Systems is looking for a Principal Research Scientist in the area of human-centered decision support tools. In this role, you will serve as Principal Investigator or Project Technical Lead, leading research and development of tools for analyzing a mix of static and streaming data sources using probabilistic and symbolic reasoning. You will create tools to support current user workflows and invent new workflows to exploit and support autonomy. You will work closely with user interface designers and developers to ensure a good user experience. You will support our goal to leverage human-machine teaming in order to build trust in autonomy and automation, and in turn to increase users' confidence in the decisions they make. 
Who we are:The BAE Systems’ Intelligent Adaptive Software (IAS) directorate is a leading multidisciplinary R&D department dedicated to meeting critical U.S. military needs. Our directorate specializes in research in computer science, software engineering, and artificial intelligence for autonomous systems – investigating, developing, and evaluating innovative technology across a variety of domains for customers in the Department of Defense (DoD) and Intelligence Community (IC). Our research spans the R&D lifecycle, from basic and applied research up through advanced technology demonstration to transitioning our results to business areas within our organization and in some cases directly to our government customers.  Join us for amazing R&D challenges and work on revolutionary advanced computing technology that makes a direct real-world impact!
What we offer: • Cutting edge advanced computing research
• Application to real-world challenge problems 
• Collaboration with investigators from top computer science departments
• Exceptional teammates
• Opportunities to learn and grow
• A fun workplace, excellent benefits, and every other Friday off
Who you are:We seek an experienced research scientist with a proven track record of R&D innovation, whose passion lies in envisioning and realizing innovative technology to enable human-centered analytics, mixed-initiative systems, and human-in-the-loop solutions. You bring a clear research vision, are experienced in crafting whitepapers and proposals presenting your ideas, and have demonstrated technical leadership to execute your research agenda. You bring a strong publication record in peer-reviewed venues and are actively engaged in the broader research community through professional service activities.  
As a Principal Research Scientist you will lead research and development efforts through all phases of its lifecycle, from brainstorming and conceptualization, to opportunity identification and development, through research and experimentation during program execution. Ideally you have knowledge about or are willing to learn about command, control, intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (e.g., C2ISR), battle management command and control (BMC2), multi-domain command and control (MDC2), and/or intelligence analysis (e.g., sensemaking). While some of our work is fundamental research (i.e., advancing scientific frontiers) much of our work is also in the application of those new scientific to grounded domains and problems.
Typical Education & Experience Bachelor's Degree and 12 years work experience or equivalent experienceRequired Skills and Education 
Demonstrated technical leadership with strong written and communication skills. 
Experience in preparing highly technical briefs for DoD and IC customers (e.g., DARPA, IARPA, AFRL) is strongly preferred. Commensurate experience with similar customer base will be considered.
Experience in research program planning and execution.


Highly respected in science and technology (S&T) academic communities, with strong leadership in relevant professional community as demonstrated through one or more of the following: 
Publication record
Program/review committees
Standards participation
Invited talks/panels
Patents 


Strong knowledge of the Artificial Intelligence (AI), Computer Science (CS), and/or Mathematics research and academic space with expertise in one or more of the following: 
human-machine teaming
machine learning
symbolic reasoning / logical reasoning
natural language processing
social computing 


Eligible for a SECRET clearance
Preferred Skills and Education 
Preferred Education – MS or Ph.D. in field related to mathematical and computing sciences
Preferred Skills – Capability in the following areas is also desired:
Leading an integrated product team (IPT)
Top Secret/SCI clearance
System evaluation


About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 90,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services.The Electronic Systems (ES) sector spans the commercial and defense electronics markets with a broad portfolio of mission-critical electronic systems, including flight and engine controls; electronic warfare and night vision systems; surveillance and reconnaissance sensors; secure networked communications equipment; geospatial imagery intelligence products and systems; mission management; and power-and energy-management systems. Headquartered in Nashua, New Hampshire, ES employs approximately 13,000 people globally, with engineering and manufacturing functions primarily in the United States, United Kingdom, and Israel. In this role, the candidate will support research and development for Construction of Computing Systems; Analysis, Visibility and Insight into Computing Systems; and Foundations of Advanced Computing applied to trusted computing in Autonomy. This include: programming languages, modeling of computing systems, development tools, compilers, and probabilistic programming; Static and Dynamic analysis, run time instrumentation and verification, reverse engineering, explainable software, artificial intelligence, trustworthy systems; OS for distributed Systems, computer architecture, distributed computing, compiler backend and optimization, formal methods. The candidate will be engaged in R&D efforts through all phases of its lifecycle, from brainstorming and conceptualization, to opportunity identification and development, to leading research and experimentation during program execution. The candidate will craft whitepaper and proposals elements encapsulating ideas, publish and present results in peer-reviewed venues, and actively engage in the roader research community through professional leadership activities. He/she will focus on trusted computing, from clean-slate architectures to software assurance to self-aware and self-adapting software, with applications to autonomy. Our team includes software engineers with a dedicated passion for creating first of kind systems, as well as computer scientists and engineers with a compulsion to extend their fields. Our organization brings deep military roots and subject matter experts to help you understand the nation’s problems. You will bring technical leadership and creativity to strengthen our technical roadmaps. The end result is the opportunity to tackle and solve complex problems that will help our nation continue to succeed. The BAE Systems’ Intelligent Adaptive Software (IAS) directorate is a leading multidisciplinary R&D department dedicated to meeting critical U.S. military needs. Our directorate specializes in research in computer science, software engineering, and artificial intelligence for autonomous systems – investigating, developing, and evaluating innovative technology across a variety of domains for customers in the Department of Defense (DoD) and Intelligence Community (IC). Our research spans the R&D lifecycle, from basic and applied research up through advanced technology demonstration to transitioning our results to business areas within our organization and in some cases directly to our government customers.At BAE systems the candidate will leverage:• Cutting edge advanced computing research• Application to real-world challenge problems • Collaboration with investigators from top computer science departments• Exceptional teammates• Opportunities for professional growthTypical Education & Experience Typically a Bachelor's Degree and 6 years work experience or equivalent experienceRequired Skills and Education 
Ph.D. degree and 0-2 years work experience, Master’s degree and 3+ years of work experience, Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of work experience, or equivalent experience. 
Demonstrated technical innovation with strong written and communication skills. 

Visibility in science and technology (S&T) academic communities, with participation in relevant professional community as demonstrated through one or more of the following: 

Publication record
Program/review committees
Standards participation
Invited talks/panels
Patents 



Strong knowledge of Computer Science (CS) research and academic space with expertise in one or more of the following:

hardware supported host-based computer security protections (RISC-V – based)
software assurance for autonomous cyber-physical systems
developing warning and diagnosis techniques for advanced persistent threats
Eligible for a SECRET clearance


Preferred Skills and Education 
Preferred Education – MS or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field 

Preferred Skills -- Capability in the following areas is also desired::

Top Secret/SCI clearance
Software engineering
Test and integration


About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 90,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services. The Electronic Systems (ES) sector spans the commercial and defense electronics markets with a broad portfolio of mission-critical electronic systems, including flight and engine controls; electronic warfare and night vision systems; surveillance and reconnaissance sensors; secure networked communications equipment; geospatial imagery intelligence products and systems; mission management; and power-and energy-management systems. Headquartered in Nashua, New Hampshire, ES employs approximately 13,000 people globally, with engineering and manufacturing functions primarily in the United States, United Kingdom, and Israel. We employ more than 700 clinical research professionals and 4,500 scientists on an average workday on a temporary, project and full-time basis in a broad spectrum of industries and disciplines.  We currently have an exciting opportunity in the San Francisco area as a Data Scientist I Duties: A Data Scientist in early development Clinical Operation has a combination of statistical programming skills, SQL capability, and analytic and modeling experience.  The candidate will work in the Predictive Analytics team and will specialize in complex data analysis and programming. The candidate is expected to support Data Scientists and provide analysis and insight based on operational and clinical data to multiple stakeholders and to inform data driven decisions at the program/study team level and application and tool development and design. The candidate will support innovation in the Predictive Analytics space leveraging Big Data, internal and external data sets and new methods of analyses to support clinical operations.  
 Build statistical or deterministic models with minimal oversight

 Development experience a plus.

details:
Our client is currently seeking a DATA SCIENTIST - INTERMEDIATE   
Job Description: 
The Data Scientist will play a key role in delivering innovative scientific breakthroughs by applying predictive analytics, machine learning and statistics to product recommendations. You will work closely with interdisciplinary scientists and stakeholders to predict product performance and provide personalized seed prescriptions for growers while developing novel analytical models and best practices for complex data analyses.

Responsibilities: 
Design and prototype models with artificial intelligence, operations research, machine learning, and statistics in order to solve challenging analytics problems influencing farmer decisions 
Collaborate with Engineers to automate analytical models and deliver value @ scale 
Conduct scientific presentations regularly with leadership teams 

Basic Qualifications 

PhD or Masters in Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline with a focus on operations research or optimization 

At least 1 year research experience in applications of operations research 

At least 1 year experience with R programming 

At least 1 year experience with CPLEX or other solvers 

At least 1 year experience with MILP and/or MIQCP 

Ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, precise and actionable manner 

Preferred Qualifications: 

Ability to implement new algorithms efficiently and rigorously 

At least three year research experience with operations research 

At least one year research experience with modeling language such as CPLEX and AMPL 

At least three year experience with R programming 

Knowledge and experience in plant biology, breeding, agronomy or genetics  

Must Haves:

At least 1 year operations research experience. More experience on operations research is preferred. Excellent R coding skill sets.

A PhD, preferably in Operations Research, Statistics, math or computer science is highly desired. If the individual only has a Master’s Degree, they must have at least 1 year of real world experience. 

A PhD and academic experience will suffice.

Candidate should have at least 1 year of experience with 'R' or Matlab.  1 year+ experience with CPLEX, GAMS, PUN, AMPL or other solvers experience. 

Requires 1 yr. of experience with MILP and/or MIQCP.

Will work on Optimizations, Mathematical formulations, improvement to formulations.

This position is in the Chief Data Office where statistical analysis, machine learning, and use of Big Data is critical to the success of the business. Is a member of a group with advanced skills in the use of predictive modeling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data science techniques to collect, explore, and identify the right data to be analyzed from internal and external sources to explain or predict behavior and/or solve a variety of business problems and monetize products for sale. The ideal candidate will possess one or more strengths in areas of machine learning to include deep learning, natural language processing, forecasting, reinforcement learning, optimization, and classification. Requirements:Proficiency and Expertise in multiple toolsets to include R, Python, Java, Spark, H2O, Hadoop Ecosystem, Tensorflow, and others. The ideal candidate will have domain expertise in one or more business verticals to include; supply chain, finance, engineering, operations, and planning. Strong best practices in data science process to include data collection, data cleansing, data validation, data modeling, model evaluation, visualization of insights, communicating insights to business leaders and others, and a strong sense of identifying the right questions to ask of the data. Education: Preferred Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing; Data Analytics, Machine Learning or Business Analyst nanodegree; or equivalent experience. Our success is a result of our commitment to the best—the best people, the best placements, the best solutions and the best results.

title: Data Scientist

details:
Data ScientistPerr&Knight has always done quantitative research, but with the availability of big data now we’re leveraging more sophisticated analytics for our clients.  That's why we're looking to hire an experienced Data Scientist in our Actuarial consulting area in Boca Raton, Florida. In a work environment that’s casual and independent, you'll work directly with insurance clients to design analytic solutions for each project. Plus, as our analytics area is growing, you’ll be able to shape which software tools the department will use and, if necessary, to train others. To bolster your skills and make you an even more valuable resource, we’ll also encourage you to attend data science conferences and stay informed on the latest tools and technologies. This is a solid opportunity to join our actuarial team and use machine learning algorithms and statistics to help our clients successfully navigate the future. It will appeal to individuals mature enough to work independently on client projects and meet deadlines.As our Boca Raton, Florida-based Data Scientist, your first mission upon hire will be to gain a thorough understanding of our actuarial and analytics business processes and position yourself in our growing analytics area to use your expertise and, ultimately, to lead the direction of the unit. We'll count on you to perform complex programming and analytics to determine pricing and market segmentation opportunities for our insurance industry clients. The Data Scientist will have direct contact with clients and may eventually assume supervisor responsibilities. We're seeking problem solvers who want to analyze data and creatively come up with solutions for clients. Your work will vary with each client, keeping the job interesting and challenging. Someone who would shine in this role has strong statistical knowledge along with proven project management skills and has the ability to balance his or her statistical analysis with client deadlines. We’ll measure your performance not only on how well you follow best practices in analytics, but also on your ability to work with others, to have good project management skills and to create and maintain positive client interactions.To recap.  In this role you'll identify, collect, verify and prepare  client data and external data for use in predictive analytic engagements; handle big data and construct datasets to facilitate analytics in the business of insurance; use variable selection and regularization techniques; develop optimal models/machine learning algorithms following industry best practices and latest industry developments; design and implement metrics to monitor model expectations against experience to determine areas of model weakness; recommend changes to client underwriting selection criteria, rating factors and other business operations based on the output from the predictive models; and prepare written reports of findings for discussion and/or presentation to clients. What You Bring to the Table:• Knowledge and understanding of statistical theory and machine learning techniques, including generalized linear models, decision trees, AI and clustering techniques.• 3+ years of relevant statistical modeling and data mining work experience.• Excellent programming skills including expertise in R and SQL. Ability to use advanced techniques to handle big data with structured and unstructured data.• Strong Project Management skills in order to meet deliverables• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with professionals from other disciplines who may be geographically dispersed• Excellent oral and written communication skillsTop Candidates Have:• Predictive Analytic certification• Experience in consulting/insurance industry• Are located near or are willing to relocate to one of our offices in Santa Monica, CA; Jersey City, NJ; Fort Worth, TX; Cincinnati OH, or Boca Raton, FL office.About Perr&Knight:Founded in 1994, Perr&Knight provides insurance consulting and software solutions to the property & casualty and accident & health industries. Services include actuarial consulting, product development, insurance policy and forms consulting, regulatory compliance, state filings, licensing, technology consulting, statistical reporting, data services, and predictive analytics. Software includes StateFilings.com, a leading cloud-based state filings management solution. With offices in Santa Monica, Boca Raton, the New York Metro Area, Fort Worth, and Cincinnati, and more than 100 insurance professionals, Perr&Knight is among the largest independent actuarial and insurance consulting firms in the United States.

As our Boca Raton, Florida-based Data Scientist, your first mission upon hire will be to gain a thorough understanding of our actuarial and analytics business processes and position yourself in our growing analytics area to use your expertise and, ultimately, to lead the direction of the unit. We'll count on you to perform complex programming and analytics to determine pricing and market segmentation opportunities for our insurance industry clients. The Data Scientist will have direct contact with clients and may eventually assume supervisor responsibilities. We're seeking problem solvers who want to analyze data and creatively come up with solutions for clients. Your work will vary with each client, keeping the job interesting and challenging. Someone who would shine in this role has strong statistical knowledge along with proven project management skills and has the ability to balance his or her statistical analysis with client deadlines. We’ll measure your performance not only on how well you follow best practices in analytics, but also on your ability to work with others, to have good project management skills and to create and maintain positive client interactions.To recap.  In this role you'll identify, collect, verify and prepare  client data and external data for use in predictive analytic engagements; handle big data and construct datasets to facilitate analytics in the business of insurance; use variable selection and regularization techniques; develop optimal models/machine learning algorithms following industry best practices and latest industry developments; design and implement metrics to monitor model expectations against experience to determine areas of model weakness; recommend changes to client underwriting selection criteria, rating factors and other business operations based on the output from the predictive models; and prepare written reports of findings for discussion and/or presentation to clients. What You Bring to the Table:• Knowledge and understanding of statistical theory and machine learning techniques, including generalized linear models, decision trees, AI and clustering techniques.• 3+ years of relevant statistical modeling and data mining work experience.• Excellent programming skills including expertise in R and SQL. Ability to use advanced techniques to handle big data with structured and unstructured data.• Strong Project Management skills in order to meet deliverables• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with professionals from other disciplines who may be geographically dispersed• Excellent oral and written communication skillsTop Candidates Have:• Predictive Analytic certification• Experience in consulting/insurance industry• Are located near or are willing to relocate to one of our offices in Santa Monica, CA; Jersey City, NJ; Fort Worth, TX; Cincinnati OH, or Boca Raton, FL office.Related Keywords: statistical theory, machine learning, predictive analytics, statistical modeling, data mining, linear models, decision trees, AI, clustering techniques, technical project management

details:
USRA's Research Institute for Advanced Computer Science (RIACS) operates a Quantum Artificial Intelligence Lab at NASA's Ames Research Center that conducts strategic multi-disciplinary, integrative research and science that supports NASA's long-term mission requirements. Research focuses on testing and evaluating emerging quantum hardware, investigations of quantum mechanisms that may be used to provide a quantum advantage, development of new algorithms and software for quantum computing, and application of quantum computing to a range of real-world problems involving planning and scheduling, machine learning, and fault diagnostics. The team works in partnership with a number of organizations from academia, industry and the U.S. Government.Position Summary: The Research Scientist for Quantum Computing will design experiments to run on emerging hardware to give insights into quantum approaches to problems of interest to NASA and other partners from the U.S. Government, academia and industry. The researcher explores the robustness of the hardware, develops best practice programming techniques for quantum hardware, and illuminates the inner workings to better understand the mechanisms that can be used to provide a quantum computational advantage. Example research problems include:
Investigate effect of flux noise in the strong coupling regime on the rate of multi-qubit tunneling and performance of quantum algorithm
Develop a numerical model for inductively coupled transmon qubits
Analyze characteristics of multi-qubit chaotic dynamics
Investigate the potential of many-body delocalization phenomena for speed up in quantum annealing and related algorithms
Develop new analytical, or experimental, or numerical techniques to better analyze realistic quantum computational paradigms
Develop, and test applications of quantum computing for specific sponsor problems such as those involving planning and scheduling of unmanned aerial systems and autonomous ground vehicles and mobile robots, data analysis of images for Earth Science and Space Science applications and a number of other partner problems in the domain of optimization and machine learning
 Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
Design, run, and analyze application-specific experiments on near-term quantum hardware, including quantum annealers and gate-model chips, and quantum simulators. Potential applications include optimization for robust network design, resource allocation, planning & scheduling, fault diagnosis, and machine learning
Potential applications include optimization for robust network design, resource allocation, fault diagnosis, and machine learning.
Design appropriate benchmarking approaches with application related problem sets.
Contribute to the development of a software platform that enable the most effective use of near-term quantum hardware, including programming middleware, such as mapping, embedding, circuit compilation, parameter setting, in both quantum annealers and gate-model quantum processors.
Perform experiments and analyses that elucidate quantum mechanisms that can be harnesses for quantum advantage or greater robustness, with an eye to improved quantum algorithm design.
Identify and run appropriate classical (non-quantum) algorithms for comparison.
Contribute technical content to research proposals, research publications, technical briefings, and white papers.
Other job related duties as assignedRequired Qualifications: 
0 to three years of Postdoctoral work and publication experience in the field of Quantum Physics, or Applied Mathematics, or Applied Computer Science 
A strong track record of research success as evidenced by publishing related work in peer reviewed journals, and contributing to obtaining new funding in the areas above.
Excellent organizational and communication skills.
 Education: Ph.D. degree in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Computer Engineering Desired Experience: 
Experience developing numerical models and algorithms
Experience designing, running and analyzing application-specific experiments on quantum hardware
Experience building tools that enable effective use of near-term quantum hardware
Experience with optimization and/or machine learning methods
 Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: 
Ability to work independently and effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Ability to prioritize tasks, coordinates work of others, and meets multiple deadlines.
 Technology:
Proficiency in Microsoft Office or similar and its applications.
Understanding of the near-term hardware platforms of quantum computing, specifically superconducting-qubit based chips
Working Conditions: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, etc. This is largely a sedentary role.Travel: Minimal travel.Applicants should apply to the posting at https://usracareers.silkroad.com/ and include a letter of interest, resume, or curriculum vita. Review of candidates will begin immediately. Additional information on USRA can be found at www.usra.edu. USRA is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Sr. Automation Test Engineer Job Description 


Sr. Automation Test Engineer will work closely with IT Infrastructure Test team in building and executing comprehensive suites of automation test plans and test cases, maintaining and adding to the existing automation framework, continued evaluation of test cases for inclusion in regression, automation for newly integrated features, and development of toolsets to augment global Infrastructure testing. 
Define strategy and processes, bringing automation in line with existing functional aspect of the test effort.
This position is responsible to design, build, test and deploy effective test automation solutions. Execution of automated testing for variety of Windows 7/10 client core operating system images on laptop, desktop and VDIs, computer performance testing, high/low utilization of computing resources as well as system drivers testing. 


Role and Responsibilities

Coordinate with Test Manager and IT support engineers to deliver stable enterprise software products 
Technical Leadership – research and advocate new technologies, designs, and products to maintain a modern infrastructure and add value to the enterprise

details: McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payors, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. We believe in the importance of strong, vital organizations because we know that patients can only be healthy when our system is healthy. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our missionby joining McKesson you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our companyand of healthcare. At McKesson, you'll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that's vital to us all. We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career. Wherever you contribute here at McKesson, you will have the ability to make a real impact in the lives of others. Current Need The Data Scientist for McKesson Data & Analytics (mDNA) will be based in our Atlanta office. As part of the mDNA team, the person will provide in-depth advanced analytical insights while working in a cross-functional team environment to solve business problems. By providing critical analytics support, this person will work with Senior Data Scientists to develop insights and analytics models to help key stakeholders. The role will require analytical skills and tactical responsibilities to provide insights and recommendations. Position Description The Data Scientist will perform the following:  Project Support:  o Support a cross-functional team and provide in-depth data insights for complex business problems that can be approached with advanced analytics o Work closely with the Sr. Data Scientist to deliver results o Coordinate and collaborate with program managers and other internal stakeholders including gathering requirements and modeling criteria o Leverage tools and resources to plan, evaluate and execute strategic initiatives o Continuously improve processes and operations  Advanced Analytics:  o Rapidly perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, and uncover interesting trends and relationships o Analyze and model structured data and implement algorithms to support analysis using advanced statistical and mathematical methods from statistics, data mining, econometrics, and operations research o Perform advanced analytics techniques to mine unstructured data, using methods such as document clustering, topic analysis, named entity recognition, and document classification (machine learning and natural language processing is a plus) o Strong understanding of large database mining tools and statistical languages utilized to efficiently build approaches and execute on analytical use cases. Specific experience with R, Python, Hive, Pig, Spark, SAS, Hadoop (MapReduce, HBASE), Java, Trifacta, H2O, Tableau and SQL is preferred. Experience with SAP and IBM DataStage is also beneficial. o Communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations Qualifications Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience Critical Skills  Bachelor degree with a minimum of 5 years of related experience; MS with a minimum of 2 years of related experience; PhD, with degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Econometrics, or related fields Strong quantitative analysis background and experience in working with large, complex data systems to aggregate, organize, and prepare data for use in business analysis Strong mathematical background with strong knowledge in at least one of the following fields: statistics, data mining, statistics, operations research, econometrics, and/or information retrieval (machine learning and natural language processing is a plus) Deep experience in extracting, cleaning, preparing and modeling data Experience with command-line scripting, data structures, and algorithms; ability to work in a Linux environment Data visualization and/or power point presentation skills to effectively communicate insights is a plus Proficiency in analysis (i.e. R, and SAS) packages Up to 10 15% travel may be required (domestic and international)  Additional Knowledge & Skills  Able to use sound judgment and prioritize Must be flexible, team oriented and able to accept and create change Fast and capable learner Enjoys working with numbers and data sets Enjoys process improvement projects Mature Confidence/Integrity Results Oriented, Enthusiastic, Creative thinker  Education  Bachelor degree with a minimum of 5 years of related experience; MS with a minimum of 2 years of related experience; PhD, with degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Econometrics, or related fields  Physical Requirements General Office Demands Physical Requirements General Office Demands Benefits & Company Statement McKesson believes superior performance individual and team that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it's flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population. We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. But we can't do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our missionwhatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our companyand of healthcare. At McKesson, you'll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Data ScientistLocation: St. Louis, MODuration: Direct Hire/Permanent Apply: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] Kelly IT is currently seeking a Data Scientist for a direct hire, permanent role with our healthcare client in St. Louis, MO.  The Data Scientist is responsible for advanced and predictive data analytics using big data and data science technology for healthcare innovation. Responsibilities:
 Perform analysis using data science techniques on structured and unstructured data sets, and develop algorithms for targeted business needs.
 Designs and develops data models to predict member outcomes or future impact of key member decisions.

 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Informatics, Econometrics, Engineering, or Experimental Science with 1-3+ years of professional experience.
 Experience in quantitative analysis and data science, including data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, statistical modeling, large scale data acquisition, transformation, and structured and unstructured data analysis.
 Experience with database technologies, including Oracle, SAP, DB2, Teradata, MS SQL Server, SAP HANA, and MySQL.
