details: Job Description Looking to develop innovative algorithm and software solutions for challenging real-world problems in entrepreneurial, collaborative, agile, multidisciplinary teams focused on advancing the state-of-the-art? You’ve found the right place!BAE Systems is looking for a Research Scientist to join their Special Activity Exploitation (SAX) research group. SAX is part of BAE Systems’ FAST Labs division which is heavily involved in advanced research concepts primarily from the various government research labs and organizations, including DARPA and IARPA. Members of the group are involved in the entire cycle of research development, from the initial concept ideation and program shaping with potential customers and new business pursuits through the execution and transition of research concepts to BAE Systems’ business areas and products. Most programs involve small teams of principal engineers and academically strong assistant researchers.  The SAX directorate is a cutting-edge, multidisciplinary research and engineering organization that is the FAST Labs lead for invention and application of innovative machine learning, control, and optimization approaches to learn patterns of behavior from a wide range of data sources, including real-time sensor feeds. Exploitation uses of these behavioral models include anomaly and change detection, prediction of future behavior, and recognition of complex events and activities. Applications of our technology include terrestrial, maritime, and space domains over a range of sensing modalities (e.g., radar, full motion video, radio communication) spanning the technology readiness spectrum from basic research through fielded operational systems. Our cutting edge projects and opportunities advance the frontiers of science as well as contributing to practical systems that solve real problems. We are seeking a highly creative Research Scientist to contribute to the development of advanced algorithms and systems in diverse research areas applying machine learning, probabilistic reasoning, adaptive control, and/or optimization to cutting edge problems such as learning normal behavior patterns of tracked entities (e.g., dismounts, vehicles, vessels, aircraft, satellites, software-defined radios, cyber system users and hosts) to detect anomalous activity or changes in patterns, predict future behavior, or provide advance warning of impending threats to friendly assets. You must be highly motivated, have solid problem-solving abilities, and be willing to perform a wide variety of related tasks.You must be a team player with a proactive attitude and the capacity to be creative and productive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. You must have strong writing and general communication skills, and strong presentation skills are a definite plus. You may participate in meetings with customers, co-contractors, and/or sub-contractors. Some travel may be required to support customer or collaborator meetings, software integration and testing, and/or capability demonstrations.Typically our project workflow involves: (1) researching solutions developed in-house or published in scientific literature to determine applicability and identify strengths and weaknesses; (2) creating prototypes (typically in MATLAB) to support demonstration and evaluation of key algorithmic ideas on (often real) data; and (3) developing robust, real-time implementations suitable for target hardware/software environments.As a successful candidate, you: (a) will participate in small teams of research, software, and (potentially) systems engineers that may include members from collaborating universities, other companies, and customer organizations; and (b) will interact directly with customers to participate in design reviews, support integration, testing, and demonstration, and/or produce clear, user-friendly documentation. Solid general written and oral communication skills are critical to your professional success in this role.U.S. citizenship is required, as is an active US Secret Clearance. Work for this position will be performed in the Metropolitan DC/Virginia area. Typical Education & Experience Bachelor's Degree and 2 years work experience or equivalent experienceRequired Skills and Education Required education: Bachelors Degree with 2+ years experience or a Masters degree in Computer Science or Engineering-related discipline with or without professional experience (specialization in Machine Learning, Statistics, Computational Neuroscience, and/or Controls and Optimization particularly valuable); - An Active US Secret clearance and Top Secret-SCI eligibility are required- Detailed knowledge (including understanding of strengths and weaknesses of various approaches), application, analysis, and development in at least one of machine learning, probabilistic reasoning, adaptive control, and/or optimization- MATLAB proficiency to perform: (1) rapid design, prototyping, analysis, and simulation of, and experimentation with, advanced algorithms and applications; and (2) data analysis- Strong writing and presentation skills- Experience presenting to technical audiences- Work for this position will be performed in the Metropolitan DC/Virginia areaPreferred Skills and Education - Record of publications will be viewed favorably About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 90,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services. BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 90,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services.The Electronic Systems (ES) sector spans the commercial and defense electronics markets with a broad portfolio of mission-critical electronic systems, including flight and engine controls; electronic warfare and night vision systems; surveillance and reconnaissance sensors; secure networked communications equipment; geospatial imagery intelligence products and systems; mission management; and power-and energy-management systems. Headquartered in Nashua, New Hampshire, ES employs approximately 13,000 people globally, with engineering and manufacturing functions primarily in the United States, United Kingdom, and Israel. details:
Overview
Vencore is a proven provider of information solutions, engineering and analytics for the U.S. Government. With more than 40 years of experience working in the defense, civilian and intelligence communities, Vencore designs, develops and delivers high impact, mission-critical services and solutions to overcome its customers most complex problems. Headquartered in Chantilly, Virginia, Vencore employs 3,800 engineers, analysts, IT specialists and other professionals who strive to be the best at everything they do. Vencore is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Responsibilities

Position requires

and skills in a variety of scientific disciplines in support of advanced research and development activities (basic research, applied research and advanced technology development). Qualified individuals must hold a degree in a core scientific discipline or demonstrated knowledge and expertise in core disciplines. Core disciplines include, but are not limited to, photogrammetry, geodesy, mathematics, statistics, physics and image sciences. Scientists must be capable of independent research and development as well as leadership of small teams. The focus of effort includes conducting research and development in new areas through innovative ideas and experimentation. This position will apply expertise from core sciences that support NGA’s mission to meet its requirements and provide the best solution to the broader NSG.Duties include: • Assist with conducting research and experimentation in support of the core sciences within NGA (e.g. photogrammetry, remote sensing, mathematical and statistical).• Assist with designing and executing experiments to proof-of-concepts in both laboratory and operational environments.• Apply scientific domain knowledge to the development of innovative and original algorithms and techniques that are required for the success of Agency as the Functional Manager for GEOINT. • Assist with conducting research and development projects in which the scientific research aspect dominates. This may include working with contractor scientists and other domain experts. • Explain important and relevant scientific issues and trends to non-technical audiences (e.g., operational, leadership and management personnel). Provides this information both verbally and in writing. Take the initiative in identifying these issues and trends and prepares research proposals for management. • Assist with the forming of strategic technology investments and feasibility of research areas and projects. • Assist with demonstrating and documenting the ability to translate mission requirements into information terms and to support SAR imagery analysis.

Qualifications

Required:• Bachelor’s degree within a core science area with 20 years of total experience and 15 years of specialized experience in core disciplines defined below.• Demonstrated specialized experience with NTM, commercial and airborne sources and exploitation capabilities.• Computer programming skills in multiple languages.• Demonstrated specialized experience in the intelligence community focused on state of the art GEOINT research and developmental activities.• Demonstrated specialized experience in researching and developing geospatial solutions for photogrammetry and remote sensing. • Demonstrated specialized experience in the following areas: Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT), Image Intelligence (IMINT), Open Source Intelligence (OSINT), and deep-space projects.Desired:• Demonstrated specialized experience working with various Intelligence Community and Demonstrated specialized experience in the intelligence and defense communities working on state of the art research activities. • Advanced Degree(s) in a technical or scientific field.• Published author in peer review journal(s). • Demonstrated understanding of software engineering tools to write well designed, testable, efficient code. • Demonstrated specialized experience developing and modifying software solutions by studying information needs, conferring with users, studying system flows and work processes.
title: Expert - Project Scientist

details:
Role Purpose:This position is for a technically strong engineer with effective communication and leadership skills, high energy and motivation. The qualified candidate will be working with maintenance and engineering teams in a plastics resin manufacturing facility with one of the world’s leading thermoplastic producers. The facility operates over diverse assets/machineries with varying degrees of automation and complexity. Equipment include extruders, blenders, packaging equipment, motors, PD blowers, pumps, valves, agitators, dryers, filters, centrifuges and a variety of water treatment and ventilation assets, all operating 24/7. The individual will be working independently using structured tools and methodologies (such as RCA & RCM II) combined with his analytical skills to evaluate equipment data and failure history to troubleshoot and determine root causes of failure to establish effective maintenance strategies and standards to continuously improve equipment reliability. Focus for this position is on programs for fixed assets, requiring knowledge of construction codes, modes of deterioration, corrosion, non-destructive testing and strategies for repair and replacement.Major responsibilities include:• Work with maintenance professionals and process equipment to improve reliability• Provide technical support in areas of expertise to troubleshoot and identify root causes of failures and determine best strategy to improve reliability• Review spare parts strategies to optimize equipment availability.• Work with several maintenance professionals/technicians, engineers and reliability specialists to improve their skills in trouble-shooting, root cause analysis, and development of proactive maintenance strategies.• Develop (lead development) of maintenance, construction and equipment standards as needed• Function as the point person to address technical issues in several classes of equipment as the subject-matter-expert• Lead several on-going Asset Reliability (AR) Work Processes simultaneously – FMEA, MTA (Maintenance Task Analysis), sporadic or chronic RCA, RCM, etc.• Interface with internal and global teams to translate improvements.• Identify, engineer and implement projects/programs in these operations to increase productivity and reliability.• Routinely monitor process parameters and PdM data of critical systems. Review and analyze the respective performance KPIs to predict and prevent failures.  Proactively address operational or integrity issues with corrective action recommendations.• Proactively address operational or integrity issues with corrective action recommendations.• Develop and optimize equipment strategies and lead efforts to eliminate performance killers. Operational Effectiveness Responsibilities:• Facilitates organizational effectiveness by modeling, reinforcing and coaching the elements of the Commitment Model and Critical Organizational Behaviors.• Provides appropriate coaching and mentoring to ensure the work processes are delivering meaningful business results. details:
Job Description


UES, Inc. is seeking an entry level Scientist in the area of Flexible Electronics to serve at Wright Patterson Air Force Base in Dayton, OH. The Research Scientist will be an active and collaborative member of the Flexible Electronics research team within the Materials and Manufacturing Directorate of the Air Force Research Laboratory, working at Wright Patterson Air Force Base in Dayton, OH. The research project will focus on laser manufacturing techniques towards creating high performance flexible electronics. The candidate will develop unique and efficient laser processing schemes to allow local heating and patterning of 2D materials and organic electronic materials on soft, flexible substrates while collecting in-situ spectroscopy for reaction mechanism investigation. Experience with lasers and soft materials is desired, as well as a background in electronics and/or flexible materials.  Excellent oral and written communication skills are a prerequisite for employment. The successful candidate will be self-motivated and capable of working independently, but also successfully collaborate with researchers from different technical backgrounds.



 

Requirements


Required:• A PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Electrical Engineering or related field of study. • This position is working within a government facility and requires U.S. Citizenship. Desired Technical Experience:• Experience with lasers and laser spectroscopy techniques (Raman, photoluminescence)• Experience with 2D materials or polymer materials for electronics• Background in flexible electronics 



Additional Information
UES, Inc. is an innovative science and technology company providing customers with superior research and development expertise since its inception in 1973. Our long-term success is a direct result of a strong commitment to the success of our employees. We look forward to reviewing your application. UES is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and prohibits employment discrimination for employees and applicants based on age, race, color, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, citizenship, or because he or she is an individual with a disability, protected veteran or other status protected by federal, state and local laws.

details:
WHAT WE DO:

Synovos is a rapidly growing leader and global provider of comprehensive supply chain services that drive increased productivity and profitability for our clients, including: Supply Chain Services, Asset Services, Master Data LeadershipSM and Technology. Headquartered in the US, we currently deliver our highly focused expertise through integration at more than 220 customer sites across the US as well as in Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, Ireland, and Singapore. Our nearly 700 skilled employees provide the maximum degree of client service, cost savings and production performance. Synovos offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life, paid vacation, and a 401(k) plan with company match.


HOW YOU WILL PLAY A PART:

In today's business environment, companies are continuously working to improve the reliability of their operations.  As a key partner to our customers, Synovos plays a lead role identifying and implementing improvement opportunities relating to MRO materials and processes to support the customer’s reliability goals.

We are looking for an individual who is energized by improving the status quo to deliver true value to the customer to join our reliability team. The position of Reliability Engineer is accountable to deliver hard and soft dollar savings by identifying and leading continuous improvement opportunities for single and multi-plant customers. To achieve success, the Reliability Engineer will work with the Synovos on-site personnel as well as the Customer’s Maintenance, Engineering, and Reliability resources.

Essential Functions:

Continuous improvement analysis to determine root cause(s) of equiptment failures
Process efficiency studies to increase maintenance wrench time
Spare part assessment to determine part and asset criticality
Bill of material development to support maintenance planning and determining inventory relevancy
Part standardization and re-engineering to reduce risks of supply disruption, reduce costs and improve part reliability.
Essential ReAnalyze MRO transactional and inventory data to develop spend and usage profiles to identify and prioritize opportunities that include part standardization
OEM part commercialization and part re-engineering
Document the opportunities and validate that recommendations that meet application requirement
Work with customer’s change management processes to determine the approach to implement recommendations
Utilize Lean/Six Sigma methodology to analyze current processes and develop recommendations for improvements
Establish metrics to measure effectiveness of new processes and quantify benefit to customer
Prepare formal submittal documentation for the opportunities identified and presented
Submittal information details and quantifies both the current and future states, implementation plan, risk mitigation and net benefit to the customer




Effectively create a vision for change and build consensus among stakeholders to ensure success




Strong presentation skills. Comfortable presenting to all levels of management
Work independently and in cross functional teams
Takes initiative and is self-motivated
Comfortable working in a consulting relation with the customer
Solid working knowledge of mechanical and electrical equipment and part
Willing to travel up to 50%
Working knowledge of CMMS software (knowledge of Maximo a plus)

Required Experience
A Minimum of 5 years’ experience in maintenance and/or reliability
Bachelor of Science in Engineering or Professional Engineering License preferred
Certified Reliability Manager (preferred)
Strong MS Office skills

details:
Responsible for improving the reliability of equipment, processes and utilities by incorporating the principles of Reliability Centered Maintenance. Apply techniques toward the improvement of asset reliability (under the direction of supervisor).  Responsible for prescribing reliability driven actions that require independent and/or collaborative judgment.

Responsibilities: Essential Duties


Trend work to identify high cost and/or high frequency maintenance activities and identify actions to improve reliability.




Define scope and develop business justification analysis for modification work as assigned by Management.




Initiates failure analysis effort for key Work Orders.




Analyze and report historical data in Computer Maintenance Management System (CMMS) needed to perform reliability process and develop maintenance strategies.




Lead reliability reviews and perform failure modes analysis for new assets being developed through capital project process.




Identify cost reduction opportunities through extended parts life, reduced labor cost and other improvement techniques.




Analyze life cycle cost reports for new equipment.




Experience with Total Quality Management (TQM) methods (e.g. "six sigma") or reliability centered maintenance preferred




Report to Senior Management the metrics of the maintenance systems, e.g. downtime, OEE and spending results.




Backs up the store room operation as needed.




Defines, develops, administers and refines the maintenance program for all assets. This would include: Set up Preventative Maintenance (PM) strategy for all new equipment, review of existing PM effort to insure that the right work is being done in the correct time interval and oversee the Product Data Management (PdM) efforts in area of responsibility.    




Expertise: Knowledge & Skills


Demonstrated success in delivering results on several technical challenges.



Display a solid technical understanding of engineering and maintenance principles and procedures (e.g. CMMS and its application or scheduling a series of technical tasks utilizing software-based tools).
Demonstration application of engineering principles on individual/small projects.
Risk Assessment, Lean/Six Sigma Green belt and experience a plus.
Experience with Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) preferred
Demonstrates leadership skills.
Familiarity with equipment Lifecycle Management (LCM), Failure Mode Effect Analysis (FMEA), Life Cycle Cost (LCC), Total Cost of Ownership (TCO)
Ability to organize and present technical and project mgt. overviews without assistance.
Knowledge of cGMP manufacturing.
Must have excellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to efficiently communicate with cross-functional teams and management on recommended course of action, with minimal assistance.
Must have proficient computer skills and be experienced using CMMS systems.
Has the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and work on multiple projects simultaneously.
Must be a self-starter, detail oriented and able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Must embrace working in a fast-paced, team-oriented, cross-functional environment.


Qualifications:

Required:


B.S. degree in Engineering and 5-7 years of experience in Reliability Engineering




Limited domestic travel may be required


Desired:


M.S. in Engineering and 8 or more years of experience in reliability, pharmaceutical industry experience preferred.

Job Description



UES, Inc. is seeking an entry level Scientist in the area of Flexible Electronics Additive Manufacturing, to serve at Wright Patterson Air Force Base in Dayton, OH. The successful candidate will be an active and collaborative member of the Flexible Electronics research team within the Materials and Manufacturing Directorate of the Air Force Research Laboratory. The research project will focus on the manufacture and experimental characterization of printable conductive and insulating materials. The successful candidate will develop efficient print path and experimental validation strategies to optimize the manufacturing of electronics devices, such as multilayered circuit boards and antennas. The candidate will also work closely with AFRL material synthesis researchers to optimize new conductive and dielectric inks for the printing process. The ability to develop systematic experimental studies that address fundamental questions of material behavior is required.
Excellent oral and written communication skills are a prerequisite for employment. The successful candidate will be self-motivated and capable of working independently, but also successfully collaborate with researchers from different technical backgrounds.

details:
Research Scientist I/II - DMPK in Rensselaer, NY

Albany Molecular Research Inc. provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries.

The Research Scientist I/II is expected to assist in a variety of laboratory procedures in the area of DMPK. The scientist is expected to have an understanding of both the theoretical and practical aspects of biology, biochemistry, and chemistry as well as demonstrate independence on performance of routine tasks.  The scientist is expected to demonstrate aptitude in a wide range of in vitro biochemical assays, sample processing, and analytical tools. 

Another key role of the scientist is to perform operations which aid in maximizing the research productivity of the laboratory staff. Day to day functions include maintaining laboratories, cleaning glassware, ordering and stocking supplies, as well as waste disposal. A major component in the scientist’s performance rating will be based on productivity, teamwork and cooperation.  

RESPONSIBILITIES


Conduct routine in vitro DMPK assays in an accurate and efficient manner, including incubations, sample processing, analysis, calculation of results, and reporting.
Assist other scientists in performing in vitro DMPK and bioanalytical assays and be able to work in a group environment.
Prepare solvents, buffers, and stock solutions of compounds and substrates under the supervision of other scientists.
Develop and maintain a working knowledge of commonly used spectroscopic and chromatographic techniques.
Keep accurate, legible and complete records of all experiments and observations.  Record all appropriate data electronically in AMRI’s databases.
Submit complete, documented, and legible reports of testing.  Ensure that data is properly filed and accessible for review in accordance with appropriate SOP’s.
Routinely discuss the status of assigned projects and potential problems with supervisor. Communicate orally and in writing unexpected occurrences which could adversely affect established timetables.
Maintain the laboratory and laboratory instruments and equipment in a clean, organized, and orderly manner. Responsible for washing, cleaning, drying, and putting away glassware in pre-assigned locations as directed by the scientific staff.
Conduct laboratory operations in a safe manner.  Maintain familiarity with the Chemical Hygiene Plan.  Exhibit safety awareness and safe work practices. Follow requirements regarding chemical and biological disposal.  Maintain compliance with all regulations at the federal, state, and local levels, as well as all appropriate SOP’s.
Organize work time so that multiple activities run concurrently.  Use time efficiently to accomplish immediate task and perform other needed activities. Manage workload and time to perform multiple projects effectively, and ensure all necessary paperwork is completed on a timely basis.
Help monitor the latest developments in specific areas of technical responsibility, and recommend and implement methods to increase the quality of products and services. 
Participate in professional development activities and training of others.


Education and/or Experience


Bachelor’s Degree or Master's degree with major in science or equivalent relevant industrial experience
0-5 years of relevant industry experience
Exposure to a laboratory environment
Computer training in the use of standard office software applications and databases
Shift:  Standard 8

details:
Job Description Advanced Computing Group Section LeadIntelligent Adaptive Software (IAS) BAE Systems is looking for an experienced technical manager to serve as Section Lead for our advanced computing group. In this role, you will report directly to the Director of the Intelligent Adaptive Software (IAS) Directorate and will work closely with the Director to lead, manage, and run the group. You will lead the group in programs spanning research thrusts such as high assurance computing, programming languages, formal methods, computer architecture, RISC-V secure computer architectures, software/system composition, explainable software, self-aware adaptive software, and other foundational technologies that enable next-generation autonomy. The goal of the group is to build the next-generation computing systems with new levels of flexibility, robustness, synthesis, adaptation, and self-protection. These technical advances enable the IAS Directorate to build first-of-its-kind systems that are autonomous, adaptive, and resilient, for example, prototyping a novel computing platform for tomorrow’s autonomous systems.Who we are: The BAE Systems’ Intelligent Adaptive Software (IAS) directorate is a leading multidisciplinary R&D department dedicated to meeting critical U.S. military needs. Our directorate specializes in research in computer science, software engineering, and artificial intelligence for autonomous systems – investigating, developing, and evaluating innovative technology across a variety of domains for customers in the Department of Defense (DoD) and Intelligence Community (IC). Our research spans the R&D lifecycle, from basic and applied research up through advanced technology demonstration to transitioning our results to business areas within our organization and in some cases directly to our government customers.  Join us for amazing R&D challenges and work on revolutionary advanced computing technology that makes a direct real-world impact! What we offer: 
Cutting edge advanced computing research
Application to real-world challenge problems  
Collaboration with investigators from top computer science departments  
Exceptional teammates  
Opportunities to learn and grow  
A fun workplace, excellent benefits, and every other Friday off  
Who you are: You are technically savvy with a years-long track record of innovation and capturing CRAD in various DoD and Intelligence Community R&D organizations, interested in collaborating with a diverse set of researchers including investigators from top computer science departments. You are an experienced technical manager with a proven track record of R&D innovation, whose passion lies in creating innovative technology to create trusted systems – systems that are secure and safe, robust and reliable, and provably correct. You bring a clear research vision, are experienced in crafting whitepapers and proposals presenting your ideas, and have demonstrated technical leadership to execute your research agenda. You bring a strong publication record in peer-reviewed venues and are actively engaged in the broader research community through professional service activities. As a Section Lead you will lead and manage research and development efforts through all phases of its lifecycle, from brainstorming and conceptualization, to opportunity identification and development, through research and experimentation during program execution.Specific Section Lead (SL) Job Responsibilities include: Staff Management: The SL serves as a first line functional supervisor for a group of researchers. The SL is responsible for career growth, personal development, objective settings, and project allocation for a group of four to eight individuals across a variety of programs in diverse technical areas. The SL must demonstrate vision and leadership to motivate and influence the group for growth and general well-being. Program Execution: The SL serves in a leadership role on highly complex research or system engineering efforts, as a program manager, or project or technical lead. The SL works across a broad range of disciplines to structure undefined programs, identify key technical issues and define alternative approaches and resolutions; applies and develops advanced technologies, principles, theories, and concepts; maintains liaison with customer or contractor representatives to manage, review, monitor, and evaluate alignment with customer’s objective and contractual requirements; defines program requirements; prepares and delivers presentations; prepares status and progress reports and periodically briefs customer representatives on the program status. Business Development: The SL provides leadership oversight and active engagement in the development and pursuit of business opportunities. The SL maintains awareness of the company’s competitive position and identifies potential new products or business and pursues them with support from company leadership; leads technical proposals or provides critical written or conceptual contribution to major proposal sections; plans critical long-range technological requirements to enhance company objectives and independently identifies and solves significant problems associated with the success of current and critical long-range objectives. Business Operations: The SL works closely with the director in executing the business plan to meet financial goals within the set upon budget and available resources. Tasks include the setting of a healthy backlog to support the staff, identifying the business opportunities, risks and opportunities to meet the financial goals, and prioritizing the marketing opportunities to grow the organization and to ensure continuous alignment of new projects with the key technology areas of the directorate.Organizational Representative: The SL may be called upon to represent the company in high visibility and rapid turnaround activities entailing travel and heavy customer/teammate interaction. Such activities are in quick response to unforeseen circumstances requiring a steep learning curve and tactful engineering professionalism.Typical Education & Experience Typically a Bachelor's Degree and 8 years work experience or equivalent experienceRequired Skills and Education 
Doctorate degree in an Engineering or Scientific field discipline with 7+ years professional experience (specialization in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Electrical Engineering or related field); Master’s degree with 10+ years professional experience; Bachelor’s Degree with 12+ years of experience. 
Highly respected in science and technology (S&T) academic communities, with strong leadership in relevant professional community as demonstrated through publication record, program/review committees, standards participation, invited talks/panels, and/or patents. 
Proved track record across all stages of business development lifecycle, culminating in crafting winning proposals with customers interested in high assurance technologies. 
Demonstrated technical leadership with strong written and communication skills; experience in preparing highly technical briefs for DoD and IC customers (e.g., DARPA, IARPA, AFRL) is strongly preferred) – commensurate experience with similar customer base will be considered. 
Demonstrated experience in impacting staff professional growth in a management or mentoring relationship. 
US Citizenship and must be eligible for a SECRET clearance.
Preferred Skills and Education 
Preferred Education – MS or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related field. 
Top Secret/SCI clearance desirable.
About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 90,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services. The Electronic Systems (ES) sector spans the commercial and defense electronics markets with a broad portfolio of mission-critical electronic systems, including flight and engine controls; electronic warfare and night vision systems; surveillance and reconnaissance sensors; secure networked communications equipment; geospatial imagery intelligence products and systems; mission management; and power-and energy-management systems. Headquartered in Nashua, New Hampshire, ES employs approximately 13,000 people globally, with engineering and manufacturing functions primarily in the United States, United Kingdom, and Israel. details: Job Description BAE Systems is looking for a Signal Processing and Communications Research Scientist to join their Assured Communications research group. The Assured Communications group works on programs and problems that involve adaptive signal processing, wireless communications, detection &estimation, information theory, deep learning, and adaptive decision and control. These technologies are applied to a number of different RF domains,such as cognitive communications, radar, electronic warfare (EW), spectrum sensing, SIGINT, to name a few. The Assured Communications research group is part of BAE Systems’ FAST Labs division which is heavily involved in advanced research concepts primarily from the various government research labs and organizations, including DARPA and IARPA. Members of the group are involved in the entire cycle of research development, from the initial concept ideation and program shaping with potential customers and new business pursuits through the execution and transition of research concepts to BAE Systems’ business areas and products. Team members are typically involved in multiple simultaneous programs with roles including technical leadership, technical development, customer interaction, program management, or new concept development. Most programs involve small teams of principal engineers and academically strong assistant researchers.  This position can be based out of our Merrimack, NH; Burlington, MA; Reston, VA; Arlington, VA; or Columbia, MD facilities, though it will require collaboration with staff across our business areas and facilities in the Northeast. Typical Education & Experience Typically a Bachelor's Degree and 8 years work experience or equivalent experienceRequired Skills and Education Strong experience with mathematical model tools and languages; such as MATLAB, Python, etc.Experience in being part of a multi-disciplinary project team in research or developmentStrong and confident communication/presentation skillsEligible for a government security clearance (will be subject to a government security investigation). Current clearance preferred. Preferred Skills and Education The ideal candidate will have a PhD or Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Physics, or similar field with 6+ years of relevant demonstrated technical research. Strength in wireless communications, signal processing, optimization detection & estimation, stochastic systems, applied statistics, and/or control Prior experience working with RF systems: radar, EW, comms, etc. About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems is a premier global defense and security company with approximately 90,000 employees delivering a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support and services. The Electronic Systems (ES) sector spans the commercial and defense electronics markets with a broad portfolio of mission-critical electronic systems, including flight and engine controls; electronic warfare and night vision systems; surveillance and reconnaissance sensors; secure networked communications equipment; geospatial imagery intelligence products and systems; mission management; and power-and energy-management systems. Headquartered in Nashua, New Hampshire, ES employs approximately 13,000 people globally, with engineering and manufacturing functions primarily in the United States, United Kingdom, and Israel. details:
We are seeking a postdoctoral researcher to work in a small, agile team at the NASA Research Park on SGT, Inc.’s multi-year QUASAR project (Quantifiable Assurance Cases for Trusted Autonomy), part of the US Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) Assured Autonomy research program.The successful candidate will undertake fundamental research into the foundations of Dynamic Assurance Cases (DACs), which aim to provide quantified assurance of trustworthiness in the design and operations of learning-enabled cyber-physical systems (LE-CPSs), for two autonomous system platforms.The postdoctoral researcher selected for this position will be responsible for directly contributing to two core research components of the assurance quantification work under QUASAR:
Developing suitable, quantifiable measures that relate to the assurance properties of an LE-CPS, in particular safety and correctness, with particular focus on the learning/autonomy functionality;
Developing and applying models for quantification of the assurance measures, based on risk scenarios, and the elements of a dynamic assurance case (DAC), along with data obtained from engineering analysis, verification, and operational/runtime monitoring. It is expected that the quantification approach will leverage a probabilistic approach so as to provide a rigorous, formal treatment of uncertainty, and to capture the stochastic nature of the overall system.
In addition to basic research, the researcher will apply the assurance quantification approach developed to the LE-CPS platforms within the Assured Autonomy Program, as part of the overall demonstration effort. In so doing, performing system and software safety analysis, developing risk scenarios, and undertaking risk assessment and apportionment may be required. The researcher would thus be expected to balance and contribute to both the research goals, and the practical engineering efforts within QUASAR. The successful candidatee will also contribute to implementation of the research results by designing algorithms and specifying the functionality required for implementing the assurance quantification approach in AdvoCATE, the Assurance Case Automation Toolset, for developing DACs. This is an opportunity to be involved at the leading edge of safety engineering and assurance technology, as applied to autonomous systems.Required Skills
Deep knowledge of, and substantial working experience with, probabilistic modeling and analysis, in particular Bayesian probability and statistics, and uncertainty modeling, propagation, and analysis.
Familiarity with graphical probabilistic models, e.g., Bayesian Networks, Dynamic Bayesian Networks, and Markov models.
Familiarity with the application of static/dynamic fault trees, event trees, and probabilistic models to safety and reliability analysis.
Working knowledge of dependability and safety analysis techniques and principles.
Working experience with developing, implementing, and applying statistical inference algorithms using packages/languages such as R, MATLAB/Bayes Net Toolbox, Java.
Understanding of, or ability to quickly assimilate and understand, assurance technologies and assurance foundations.
Excellent spoken and written English language communication skills.
Experience presenting research results to a research scientist audience.
Ability to contribute to research papers appropriate to relevant journals and conferences.
Other Desired Skills 
Familiarity with argument-based assurance and safety cases.
Experience applying probabilistic modeling and analysis techniques to engineering systems, in particular software-based systems.
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and algorithms.
title: Postdoctoral Researcher - Probabilistic Modeling and Analysis

details:
**CONTRACT TO HIRE POSITION**

SAS is seeking a full-time SAS Junior Data Scientist/Statistical Analyst consultant to work with our client, an Utilities client in Columbus, OH.

DESCRIPTION and RESPONSIBILITIES
SAS is seeking a full-time SAS Junior Data Scientist/Statistical Analyst consultant to work with our client, an Utilities client in Columbus, OH.
The consultant will perform data mining and statistical analysis to analyze and interpret customer behaviors, energy utilization and trends. Apply statistics and business analytics skills to conduct studies and develop advanced analytical tools to aid in solving high-value business problems. Communicate effectively with stakeholders to identify value opportunities with company data. Develop predictive and prescriptive systems to optimize operations and support strategic initiatives, using cutting edge information technology and data science
methods. Design and deliver clear messages using the best visualization methods to support management decision making.
The consultant will use BASE SAS, SAS/STAT and Enterprise Guide to develop the analytical processes. The consultant must have excellent communication skills and must be able to communicate about the techniques developed and results of analysis both to team members and other analysts in the organization.

QUALIFICATIONS – ESSENTIAL
• A minimum Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics or a related quantitative discipline.
• Minimum of 1-3 years’ prior experience in predictive modeling, statistical analytics, and data mining preferred.
• 1-3 years of Utilities Experience is preferred.
• Experience deriving SAS analytics and content with SAS 9.4 including:
o Apply and demonstrate expertise with efficient DATA step, SQL programming and SAS Macro programming.
• Experience developing reports and content with SAS 9.4 Enterprise products including:
o Utilizing Enterprise Guide and its functionality to create project flows which could include
aspects of data access, manipulation, summarization, and report generation to a variety of output formats and channels, etc.
o SAS\STAT
• Be proficient in Base SAS programming (DATA step), SQL programming (i.e., use of SQL pass-through or PROC SQL), as well as the SAS Macro language for use in making code more efficient
• Experience in statistical modeling techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, cluster analysis, forecasting with programming experience with SAS.
• Prepare data mining data sets for modeling.
• Develop SAS programs to access data from various sources (e.g., reading in data sources and producing datasets suitable for SAS analytics); this will most often include data preparation, analysis and predictive model development.
• Ability to write SAS/SQL statements to store, retrieve, manipulate, integrate, validate, and summarize data.
• Good written and spoken communications skills in English and thought-leadership skills.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILTIES/ACTIVITIES:
• Develop moderately complex analytical tools to solve high-value business problems - working on moderately complex projects
• Proficiently utilize analytical tools and data management skills to provide actionable business intelligence

• Develop components of predictive and prescriptive systems to optimize operations and support strategic initiatives

• Utilize inquiry skills to obtain a clear understanding of business processes and needs.
• Work with stakeholders to determine value that additional information derived from proper analyses could provide

details:
We are seeking a postdoctoral researcher to work in a small, agile team at the NASA Research Park on SGT, Inc.’s multi-year QUASAR project (Quantifiable Assurance Cases for Trusted Autonomy), part of the US Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) Assured Autonomy research program.The successful candidate will spearhead the creation of Dynamic Assurance Cases (DACs), which aim to provide quantified assurance of trustworthiness in the design and operations of learning-enabled cyber-physical systems (LE-CPSs), for two autonomous system platforms.This role involves gathering a deep understanding of the target platforms, upon which the research developed within QUASAR will be applied and experimentally demonstrated. In particular, you will acquire and assimilate domain knowledge pertaining to the target platforms and their autonomy functionality. An additional requirement is understanding and applying the techniques and principles of safety and reliability engineering. As such, a major focus is the application of core engineering techniques towards safety and correctness assurance of the target platforms.In particular, the researcher will apply QUASAR developed approaches and methodologies, e.g., for safety analysis, integrate verification and validation artifacts supporting safety and correctness, and ultimately develop dynamic assurance cases for the target platforms. This will require contributing to the practical enhancement and application of research in an engineering setting, as well as the related methodologies, processes, and tools. This is an opportunity to be involved at the leading edge of safety engineering and assurance technology, as applied to autonomous systems.Required Skills 
Working knowledge of dependability/safety analysis and assurance techniques and principles as applied to both systems and software.
Familiarity with safety/assurance cases, safety argumentation, and argument-based assurance.
Prior experience, or ability to rapidly acquire familiarity, with machine learning techniques applied in the context of safety/mission-critical systems.
Familiarity with design assurance, correctness assurance, and techniques and principles for the same.
Familiarity with ontologies and ontology development.
Excellent spoken and written English language communication skills
Experience presenting research results to a research scientist audience
Ability to contribute to research papers appropriate to relevant journals and conferences
 Other Desired Skills 
Prior hands-on experience in safety analysis and assurance of engineered systems.
Experience with formal logical techniques in computer science
title: Postdoctoral Researcher - Dependability and Safety

details:
The Pipeline Scientist is responsible for processing and assessing the quality of the data obtained by facility science instruments on board the Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA). After processing the data files, the Pipeline Scientist examines the data products generated by the pipelines to ensure that they are suitable for distribution to General Observers. The Pipeline Scientist documents the quality assurance assessment, derives calibration factors, applies the factors to the reduced data, ingests the calibrated data into the archive, and notifies observers that the data are available for downloading. The Pipeline Scientist will have up to 20% of their time available for scientific research, preferably on topics relevant to SOFIA and its scientific mission. Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
Inspect the product tree generated by automated pipelines, and run the data processing tools manually when necessary.
Identify data/instrumental artifacts and carry out corrective measure to mitigate them (e.g., identify and exclude low-quality data from subsequent pipeline processing)
Analyze products of the data processing from science observations to ensure the results are valid and not impacted by artifacts; document quality inspection results.
Compare observations of calibration sources to model calculations to derive calibration factors; document quality of calibration; apply to the associated science observations.
Verify the quality of calibration observations and the calibration products
Generate documentation for each observation with disposition status and other relevant notes.
Release files that are nominal / useable for the archive.
Perform independent research in a field aligned with SOFIA
Engage the scientific community in research work through research collaborations, visits, invited guests, workshops, conferences, etc.
Additional Responsibilities:
Ensure the protection of NASA and USRA intellectual property with respect to commercial and International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and the Export Administration Regulations (EAR) concerns through disclosures, patent applications, and adherence to NASA's scientific and technical information dissemination guidelines.
Support efforts by USRA Management to ensure that USRA conducts its business operations in an effective, cost-competitive, and professional manner
Complete required trainings as scheduled
Required Qualifications:Must be qualified for a U.S. Government Public Trust clearance.Education:PhD in physics/astronomy, or a related fieldExperience: 
Minimum 4 years astronomical observational experience
Experience with Linux Operating System , IDL and python a plus
Licenses, Certifications:n/aKnowledge, Skills & Abilities: 
Working knowledge in the application of software systems in the execution of scientific research
Excellent written and verbal communication in English is required, fluency in written and spoken German a plus.
Teamwork and the ability to work effectively with co-workers, customers, and supervisor in a professional and courteous manner.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence, speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume, ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
Working Conditions:This job primarily operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, etc. Extensive online usage. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit, use hands. Keyboarding for large time spans each day will be a significant part of this position.The job requires the ability to work onboard the SOFIA observatory, both on the ground and in flight. Some aspects of the job may require night-time work, away from the home base.While performing the duties of this job, the employee may occasionally be exposed to fumes or airborne particles. The employee also may be exposed to moving equipment, vehicles and mechanical parts. The noise level in the work office environment is typically mild. The environment on the aircraft during flight operations may become noisy and tiring. The employee must be capable of performing all duties in a technical / scientific setting including offices, laboratories, shops, and aircraft maintenance facilities as well as on the aircraft / observatory, both while on the ground and during flights. The employee may need to lift and / or move up to 50 pounds.  Travel:This position is based at NASA AMES Research Center Moffett Field, CA but some travel may be required to Armstrong Flight Research Center and international business travel for significant lengths of time.Applicants should apply to the posting at https://usracareers.silkroad.com/ and include a letter of interest, resume, or curriculum vita. Review of candidates will begin immediately. Additional information on USRA can be found at www.usra.edu. USRA is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

details:
UES, Inc. has an opportunity available for a Research Scientist focused in Aerospace Power and Thermal Subsystems to join our Aerospace Power & Propulsion division, working at Wright Patterson Air Force Base in Dayton, OH. The primary functions for this role will include modeling, simulation and analysis of design and performance of multi-disciplinary aircraft power and thermal systems. This research will focus on management of tactical aircraft power components and systems, to study performance enhancements by way of application of SOA technologies in numerical simulations with commercial software. Beginning responsibilities will include efforts in any of these areas: model development for power or thermal systems to facilitate analysis and design of future aircraft systems; system of system studies to assess and improve integrated system performance; and model based system engineering of aircraft subsystems.




• PhD/MS/BS in Electrical, Mechanical, or Aerospace Engineering is required. • Broad knowledge of electrical, mechanical and thermal systems along with expertise in modeling power systems or thermal management systems is required. • Knowledge of numerical computation methods, optimization methods, simulation methods and proficiency with MATLAB/Simulink and C/C++ is desirable.• This position is working within a government facility and requires U.S. Citizenship



Additional Information
UES, Inc. is an innovative science and technology company providing customers with superior research and development expertise since its inception in 1973. Our long term success is a direct result of a strong commitment to the success of our employees. Taking time to complete the application is your first step towards joining UES in the pursuit of technological advancement. We look forward to reviewing your application. details:
Arconic Engineered Structures (AES) is seeking Manufacturing Data Scientist to organize, create and analyze large-scale historian and SQL data sets. Our organization is dedicated to rapid, profitable growth through continuous capital investment, operational excellence and career development. Supporting the R&D Department. The ideal candidate will apply data science methods to improve and optimize our client’s performance needs, capture meaningful insights and turn them into competitive advantages. If this describes you, then we encourage you to apply. This position reports to the Director, Forging Technology and is based in Cleveland, OH. Arconic Engineered Structures (AES) serves the global aerospace and automotive markets with the most specialized engineering, highest quality, and the greatest breadth and depth of forgings and extrusions. Our vertically integrated capabilities and deep materials science expertise in aluminum and titanium structural casting is taking the industry to new heights. This BU is also home to our suite of direct and hybrid additive offerings. Headquartered in Cleveland, OH; AES employs 6000 people in 6 countries at 30 locations. AES is a business unit of Arconic (NYSE: ARNC).Profile: The primary purpose of this position is to organize, create and analyze large-scale historian and SQL data sets. This role provides the opportunity to inject ideas and influence a growing data driven culture and gain operational experience with Big Data. Compensation:Strong base salary plus variable compensation bonus structureGenerous Health Benefits beginning day 1; medical, life, dental and vision plans401(k) Program with a Company Match (up to 6%)Retirement contribution (3%)Competitive annual vacation accrual 10 annual paid holidays Employee discount programs Essential Functions: Under the direction of the Director Forging Technology, this position is accountable for development of data analytic strategies and deployment of AES smart manufacturing strategy via data driven analytics. This position includes both tactical & strategic initiatives, examples include but are not limited to:  
Perform “what if” analyses and question existing assumptions and processes. Communicate recommendations to both Operational and IT leaders. Collaborate with Alcoa Technical Center, Process Engineers and IT department to utilize hidden potential in the manufacturing systems.
Identify and correct data limitations (e.g. signal / noise ratio, sample size, inconsistencies, missing values, corruption, etc.). Key initiatives include the design and implementation of dashboards, development of key metrics, scorecards, delivery of self-service analytics, and the Identification of competitive advantages from data.
Determine potential causes of problems (e.g., increases in scrap rate or test failures; decreased yield) and devise testing methodologies for validation.
Explain the context of multiple inter-related situations (developing multi-variate regression models), asks searching, probing questions, and solicits expert advice prior to taking action and making recommendations
Guide and direct small teams to achieve project objectives including the set up and execution of smart manufacturing deployment across AES locations.
Streamline and improve existing Microsoft Excel data-based Continuous Improvement processes and systems.
Use data excellence and best practice to participate in cost savings Kaizen events and specific projects to help increase process efficiency and reduce operational cost by utilizing the Arconic DI system.
 Essential Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: 
Engineering and Technology — Knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology. This includes applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services. 
Production and Processing — Knowledge of raw materials, production processes, quality control, costs, and other techniques for maximizing the effective manufacture and distribution of goods. 
Mechanical — Knowledge of machines and tools, including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance. 
Design — Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models. 
Judgment and Decision Making — Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one. 
Systems Analysis — Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes. 
Active Listening — Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times. 
Visualization — The ability to imagine how something will look after it is moved around or when its parts are moved or rearranged. 
Perceptual Speed — The ability to quickly and accurately compare similarities and differences among sets of letters, numbers, objects, pictures, or patterns. The things to be compared may be presented at the same time or one after the other. This ability also includes comparing a presented object with a remembered object. Complex Problem Solving — Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Mathematical Reasoning — The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem. 
Problem Sensitivity — The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem. 
Selective Attention — The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted. 
Speech Clarity — The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.

Overview

The Cardiovascular Research Scientist reports to the Manager of Medical Operations, Head of Electrocardiography under limited supervision, for performing evaluation, analysis, report generation, and quality control activities for cardiac safety data (for example, ECG, Holter) collected for clinical trials.  There is extensive communication with site personnel, BioTelemetry Research Project Management, and the Physician Readers, including Cardiologists.

details:
Join us on our exciting journey!IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.Data Scientist – the roleThe Data Scientist who will support product patient-level data team within IQVIA to develop insights gained from analyzing company data. The position will use large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Our data scientists have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. For this position, we are seeking several years of direct experience with developing algorithms to match patients using de-identified data. Awareness of various techniques available to use in patient matching as well as understanding the changing nature of the patient data landscape is preferred. Using their proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights, they will comfortably interact and work with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. They have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.Your typical activities might include:
Evaluate current method to assign patient IDs and match data across many different data suppliers with various data types.
Develop innovative methods to explore and test various patient matching algorithms for accuracy across nearly two decades of de-identified patient data.
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
Develop company testing framework and test model quality.
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
Qualifications for Data Scientist
Master’s or PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other quantitative field and 5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models.
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Preferred knowledge and experience with statistical and data mining techniques. 
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts.
Preferred experience using web services such as Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc.
Preferred experience with distributed data/computing tools such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Comfortable presenting data and findings to internal and external audiences. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders.

details:
Our client is currently seeking a RESEARCH DATA SCIENTIST (GEOSPATIAL) - INTERMEDIATE  
Job Description:

As a Remote Sensing Data Scientist you will work in a fast-paced R&D team towards applying remote sensing principles and methods to develop new sensor systems, analytical techniques, or new applications for existing systems. 

You will provide scientific analysis and characterizations from the exploitation of remote sensing data. 

You will write scientific codes for radiometric calculations, noise mitigation, image reconstruction, object detection, feature extraction and classification, and machine learning. 

You will prepare reports for educating managers and partners on the capabilities of spectral data and their potential applications. 

You will collaborate closely with data scientists, breeders, other spatial and environmental scientists and developers in building the next generation of phenomics using novel remote sensing solutions at Client. 

Qualifications/Skills: 

Masters degree in Remote Sensing, Geomatics or related field. PhD Preferred. 

Strong theoretical and practical background in remote sensing, image processing and machine learning principles. 

Experience working with UAV images. 

Previous experience in statistical modeling, predictive analysis, and optimization. 

Solid foundation in curating and interpreting data from a multitude of imaging modalities (RGB, thermal, LiDAR, multi/hyperspectral, etc.). 

Experience in at least a few of the tools, environments and languages: Python, R, QGIS, OpenDroneMap, AgiSoft Photoscan, and AWS. 

Additional Info: 

Will work mainly with data scientists and engineers within the team. Will collaborate with other scientists and engineers outside of the team as well. 

Digital Phenomics is a highly dynamic team of statisticians, data scientists, imaging scientists, and modelers. This team works closely with breeders, engineers, and scientists from other groups and organization. This is fairly new team, but there are members who have been with client for years. 

Must Haves: 
Agile, energetic, self-motivated and innovative. Theoretical and practical know-how of remotes sensing principles. 
Nice to Haves: 
Knowledge of optics. PhD in remote sensing or related field.

details: Senior Data Scientist, Credit Risk Modeling Summary PenFed is hiring a Senior Data Scientist, Credit Risk Modeling in our headquarters office located in McLean, VA. The primary purpose of this job is to develops and evaluate models associated with PenFed’s lending function to quantify the organization’s credit risk exposure and evaluate the performance of established controls.  Incumbent provides statistical input for the development and implementation of policies, plans, and programs related to credit origination and portfolio monitoring.  Essential Functions Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of job duties and the position will perform other duties as assigned.    Interact with and advises Management regarding credit risk issues; formulates product strategy recommendations, and evaluates the risk in the overall loan portfolio. Aid in development of criteria for underwriting various product lines.  Autonomous end-to-end statistical model creation, Including but not limited to identifying objectives, compiling data, sampling/prepping data, feature selection, model comparison/selection, deployment and monitoring. Ensures adequate internal control processes around model development, implementation and validation are established.  Development, monitoring and maintenance of custom risk scorecards using advanced machine learning and statistical method. Recommends and implements model changes to improve performance of credit functions. Apply intermediate to advanced knowledge of financial processes and procedures, and routine modeling theories and techniques to create effective modeling solutions for a single or multiple business functions. Participate in corporate projects as requested Keep informed of new ideas and academic research within the industry, best practices, and regulatory developments through publications, membership in professional organizations and contact with other financial institutions       Assist management with maintaining PenFed’s compliance with all applicable federal, state and local laws, regulations and ordinances by abiding by PenFed compliance program and all policies, procedures, rules and regulations                    Education and Experience Equivalent combination of education and experience is considered.  Ph.D. or Master Degree in a quantitative discipline is required.  Minimum of two (2) years’ of related work experience in building statistical models and advanced data analysis. Applied experience with Logistic Regression, Linear Regression, Time Series Analysis, Decision Trees, and Cluster Analysis. Advanced programming skills to include knowledge of statistical programs (e.g. SQL, SAS, SPSS, and R). Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and implement rapid changes in project direction. Proven project management skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills required   Supervisory Responsibility This position will not supervise employees.  Licenses and Certifications There are no additional certifications required.  Work Environment While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to an indoor office setting with moderate noise.  *Most roles require working in an office setting with moderate noise and the ability to lift 25 pounds.*  Travel Limited travel to various worksites is required.    About Us Established in 1935, PenFed today is one of the country’s strongest and most stable financial institutions with over 1.6 million members and over $23 billion in assets. We serve members in all 50 states and the District of Columbia, as well as in Guam, Puerto Rico, Okinawa, and Portugal. We are federally insured by NCUA and we are an Equal Housing Lender. We are available to members worldwide, via the web, seven days a week, twenty-four hours a day. Our mission isn’t simply to help our members get by. We exist to help them realize every ounce of their potential. We exist to educate, and to encourage. We exist to usher their dreams into the land of reality. We provide our employees with a lucrative benefits package including robust medical, dental and vision plan options, plenty of paid time off, 401k with employer match, on-site fitness facilities at our larger locations, and more.  Equal Employment Opportunity PenFed management will maintain and observe personnel policies which will not discriminate or permit harassment or retaliation against a person because of race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, military or veteran status or obligation, the presence of a physical and/or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, and all statuses protected by applicable state or local law in all recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, overtime, position classifications, work assignments, facilities, promotions, transfers, employee treatment, and in all other terms and conditions of employment. PenFed will also prohibit retaliation against individuals for raising a complaint of discrimination or harassment or participating in an investigation of same. PenFed will also reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability so that they can apply for a job or perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace and the threat cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation or if the accommodation creates an undue hardship to PenFed. Contact human resources (HR) with any questions or requests for accommodation at 571-289-4710.

The Senior Project Engineer monitors activities at construction job sites. Demonstrates advanced knowledge of discipline, construction technology, design, applicable codes, standards, etc., required
